description:
Had a couple meals here, not too bad for the area. Genuine Thai staff, seating is friendly and intimate. Foods we had were a mixed bag in quality. First, the red curries were very pedestrian, not much flavor, wouldn't reorder (and I LOVE good red curry). 

The Thai steak salad we ordered both days and it was probably 4-stars for this area. Great flavor, enough for 2 to split with other items. 

Also had the Pad See Ew noodles, with pork. THESE were delicious and a generous portion. Pork was cooked perfectly, noodles tasty and not much oil, vegetables delicious. Fair price. 

Would return for more noodles and salad.
author: T J.

description:
+1 for friendly staff, plus the food came out quickly and was fresh and hot! But I got the Thai fried rice to-go here and was thoroughly underwhelmed. The rice was pretty piece-y, chicken not flavorful and the dish was kind of greasy.

Maybe try their noodles?
author: Rachel L.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Wednesday and ate this scrumptious spicy catfish curry. Not busy, excellent service, and superb food.

This place is seriously underrated!  Check it out.
author: Margot L.

description: Order takeout all the times from this joint. Food is amazing and always perfecto. Green curry medium w chicken over rice is go to / chicken satay, pad Thai and lettuce cups all are standards in our household. When we move away will be a sad day as MyIvy is rock solid
author: Matt T.

description:
So I think the standout item here is something I take for granted at other Thai spots. It's the peanut sauce. Seriously. Luxuriant with an indulgent amount of chopped peanuts on top (photo: http://bit.ly/2I3k9DD). I could take that little gravy boat and pour it directly into my mouth. I probably would have if I was at home alone in front of the TV watching something on the Food Network like "The Pioneer Woman" where Ree cheerily makes cookies out of caramel corn and peanut butter. But alas, I am watching my calorie intake, so the peanut sauce came with the $11.95 Param which was a plate of steamed spinach and broccoli (photo: http://bit.ly/2Jz75mr).

It was delicious if somewhat overpriced given that it was hardly an effort on the part of the chef. No tofu please. Having the sauce on the side at least allowed me to dip the veggies gingerly without overdoing it, no small feat. To complete my dinner, I ordered the $9 Fresh Spring Rolls, which were well put together with lettuce, spinach, basil, mint, vermicelli noodles, tofu, and carrot slivers wrapped in rice paper accompanied by guess what... yes, peanut sauce only it was on the plate in a pool for the rolls to sit on (photo: http://bit.ly/2KpvaNS). It also had a touch of chili to give the rolls a bit of a kick. Pretty healthy choices, huh. I can try the Pad Thai and Duck Curry next time.

FOOD - 4 stars...healthy selections made especially delicious by their peanut sauce
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...modern space, not that big
SERVICE - 4 stars...quite nice and friendly
TOTAL - 4 stars...My Ivy is Your Ivy and Your Ivy is My Ivy
author: Ed U.

description: Three blocks from UCSF . The food was good but why three stars ??  Minus one for service and another minus one for price . I'm in UCSF every three weeks for my moms appointments and after , I try to take her to Thai restaurant for dinner. We both like and enjoy eating Thai food . I noticed they had more togo than dine in. She was  the only waitress working and she was too busy with all the Togo that she never checked on us and Not a big portion for the price, maybe because I'm in the city . I will come back and eat because I like the food . I will update it in three week , maybe she will read this and give us a better service.
author: Miok C.

description:
Came here for a weekday lunch as this place is close to work. They seem to be mostly a take-out place; when our group of 5 arrived around noon, the restaurant itself was almost empty and there were plenty of seats, but there were a lot of people coming in to pick up take-out orders during the time that we were there. 

The ambiance is quite nice and the area is clean and well-maintained. Service was on the slow side, and it was especially frustrating that the other 4 people in my group got their dishes super fast (within 5-10 minutes) but it took over 20 minutes for my pad thai to come out, so there was an awkward period where everyone else was eating. The pad thai itself ($10.25 on the lunch menu, with choice of chicken or prawns) was decent, but I thought the portion size was a bit on the small side and it didn't have as much flavor as other pad thai dishes that I've gotten. I also wish there were more peanut pieces for more of a crunchy texture.
author: Amy C.

description:
Love this place - delicious affordable thai food with really amazing soju/sake cocktails (only $6) I got the sukiyaki and it was the perfect portion and very flavorful.  I would recommend takeout or sit-down.

Atmosphere: 3.5/5
Food: 4.5/5
Service: 5/5 (so fast)
Overall experience: 4/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
As you'll see in a lot of these reviews, delivery seems to be a huge part of this restaurant's business. Maybe one day I'll go check them out since they're not far from me, and fresher is always better. Today is not that day though! Suckered in by the promise of free, quick delivery, I hit "order" and went for it.

One look at "Lychee duck" and I knew I had to try it, too. And Tom Kha soup *gush*. I love Thai food :D. My staple Pad Thai rounded out the order.

So do I start with good news or bad news? Uh, I'm feeling pretty good...let's do good news!
The Lychee duck is DELICIOUS, just like it sounds. Duck is already amazing; soak it in lychee water and it only gets better. Of course it's not like this is a particularly complex dish, but it sure is tasty.

Tom Kha was decent but a bit middle of the road. Should be a little more savory in my opinion.

Would not order the pad thai again. I ordered it spicy and it was totally mild, which is excusable as pad thai is not traditionally served spicy. It was also super bland. Ho hum. 

Oh, as if you needed another reason to love Yelp and Eat24, I tried to order this first through Caviar...where the prices are inexplicably more than a dollar higher on every item I looked at...AND they threw on a $5 service fee before tip! Nah. I ordered with Yelp, applied a generous tip, and my total was STILL less than Caviar was BEFORE tip. 

Oh, and speed of delivery was definitely solid.

It's disappointing that they're not open late, and with the other good thai food in the area, I probably won't go back here on my own. But, if I end up here with friends or something, I won't be disappointed!
author: Chris S.

description: Came here on a Sunday at kind of an awkward hour. After reading reviews, I knew it wouldn't be anything more than average, but it was the only thai place open at the time and the only thing that could cure my hangover was a plate of pad thai. It was pretty bland, but it got the job done. The service was good, prices fair, and the place was clean.
author: Maria M.

description: Their vegetarian noodle soup is the best in the city! I order via uber eats and they always have it ready pretty quickly. They even accommodate special requests like "no broccoli"
author: Jessica M.

description:
I used to live a few blocks away and My ivy was our goto spot for Thai. I moved away and recently saw they popped up on Uber Eats.
Unfortunately The food that was delivered was terrible. I can't believe it's even the same restaurant. Bland and tasteless, it was quite simply the worst Thai food I've ever had in SF.
Avoid at all costs.
author: Dan W.

description: This is becoming a semi-regular lunch spot for me. The menu is great,and full of options! The kitchen staff is quick, which is very important when you have limited time for lunch, and the staff is very friendly. The flavors from the various items are always very well on point! Haven't been disappointed here yet! Great place to eat alone, or in a group. Many great options for their lunch specials, especially if you're looking for options other than sandwiches, or cheap Chinese food. This place is quality for any occasion.
author: Dezi S.

description: A neighborhood fav for me and my fam.... I don't agree with the 3.5 stars.... their spring rolls are great and the curry dishes are all fantastic!  Great service and always quick delivery of the food.
author: Lynn A.

description:
They are fast and the food tastes okay. My go to is the pad see eww with chicken. and the fried rice with fried chicken breast. 

Work orders from here often, so when I don't have lunch I'll join in sometimes.
author: Teeds K.

description: The service was great but the food is mild in taste all the items I ordered needed salt and all the other spices ...I looked at the food that looked so flavorful and should have been tasty but ....sadly the food tasted bland ...I don't recommend
author: Najla B.

description: Excellent neighborhood Thai restaurant. Very nice server who went above and beyond. Papaya Salad was delicious. Also enjoyed the Curry Noodle Soup and Thai Hot Tea. Friends got Pad Thai, which was tasty too. Fair prices for SF. Overall highly recommend if you're craving some Thai food!
author: Matthew M.

description: Reasonably priced and tasty.       Delivery was a but slow but that's become the standard in San Francisco.       Spring rolls were tasteless so skip them but Pad See Yu was good.      They get credit for the freshness of the vegetables.
author: chris b.

description:
Probably the worst Thai food I've had. I ordered curry for take out. When I got back home and ate the food, I thought it was pretty bland. So I had a lot of leftovers. The next morning, I opened my fridge and saw that the liquid part of the curry had separated and coagulated. This goes to show you how low the quality of this curry was. Curry should not separate. 

Safe to say I'm not trying this place again.
author: Natalie Q.

description:
Whenever we visit SF, we always make it a must to come down to My Ivy at least once. This is one of my favorite Thai places ever.

The restaurant is small/mid-sized, with a very hip vibe. The orders take some time to come out, so be prepared. 

Every dish that my family and I have ever ordered have been very fresh and very flavorful. The Yellow Curry is really good, and the shrimp fried rice is amongst my very favorites. If you're into Thai cuisine and are up in the SF area, this is a must-try.
author: Adnan A.

description:
We've ordered take out from My Ivy via door dash many times. This is prolly my favorite Thai spot. I haven't had a bad dish so far.

You can taste the fishy-ness on the pad see ew (which I love bc I love salty food). Yellow curry's on point as well.

This is your local mom and pop shop with nothing faulty about it! You can't go wrong here.
author: Nicole D.

description: They were super nice and the food was very tasty.  Clean and organized place.  I'll certainly come back.
author: Ignacio G.

description:
Nice restaurant. 

Not very big, but there's enough room for several tables. 

Vegetable Spring tools were very good. Peanut sauce flavorful. Red curry plenty spicy. The lamb could have been more tender. 

The staff is helpful.
author: Jaime J.

description:
Quick delivery within 30 minutes from Ivy Thai. If it weren't for the speedy delivery to prevent me from getting 'hangry', I wouldn't have ordered from this restaurant to begin with. 

After seeing the other reviews prior to receiving my order, I lowered my expectations knowing that it wouldnt be great, just fast. 

My 4 dishes were delivered within 30 minutes as expected. Surprisingly, my soup was still hot enough to soften the noodles it came with once I poured them together. 

I ordered the following:
2 tom yum rice noodle soups
Pad see ew
Papaya salad 

The tom yum soup reminds me a bit of pho noodle with the tomato base. It was a bit sour and tangy with a little too much sweetness. I prefer my tom yum spicy, tart and sour. 

The pad see ew was on, but it doesnt taste authentic. As other reviews have stated, it has a 'california' flair to it. I eat food pretty bland, but I must saw this dish didnt have the appropriate flavors I was hoping for. 

I actually havent had the papaya salad yet since I was too full from the other dishes. It did look pretty standard and its hard to go wrong with fresh salad, however I did smell the salad and could tell there was a ton of fish sauce. I do not recommend ordering this to the office! :)

Overall, food is decent, but not authentic and definitely not the best thai in SF. Worth giving this place a shot if you just want fast and quick food that isnt 'fast food' like mcdonalds.
author: Claire W.

description: Second time here. Had delicious drunken noodles with combo seafood. Highly recommended!
author: Kevin F.

description: I've never had a worse Thai meal. Spare yourself. They won't be around long with all the good Thai food in SF.
author: Jennifer F.

description: I'm obsessed with pad see eww... this was the most disappointing Pad See Eew I've had yet. So bland.
author: Sofia V.

description: Great lunch menu . My wife & I stopped in for a relaxing atmosphere and great bite to eat. We had  the Crispy Catfish,  clay pot seafood & chicken, the veggie Rolls, the lunch came with a simple yet satisfying soup. Great service with a welcoming feel. It's a most stop Divisadero.
author: Terrance G.

description: Food is fine. BUT a waitress will confront you when you regularly eats there and you don't leave any tip. When you try to explain, she will just turn her back on you. Rude!!! Cant believe that a tip is compulsory in this restaurant. Must change the staff of this restaurant.
author: Ashley R.

description:
It is pathetic that Pacific Heights does not have good Thai options. You'll have to head towards the Tenderloin (at Lers Ros) or Inner Richmond (at Marnee Thai) to get the traditional flavors you expect from Thai food.

I was in the mood for some light and healthy salad and the mango salad filled the craving. I was digging around for more grilled prawns, but they were generous enough to put two in there. (omg) Hmm. Yes, you can make better salad at home and for $9, there wasn't much flavor to it except lime and fish sauce. The chicken lettuce wraps are a great low carb snack, but the only dominant flavor in the sauce is Hoisin. The tom kha soup is passable.

The amiable service is welcomed, especially when I'm exhausted from my core40 workout, conveniently located one block away. And the free thai iced tea is nice with the yelp check in. But I'd consider other dining options around the area and maybe curb my Thai food craving until I'm at Lers Ros.
author: Janice C.

description: First time eating here and it was great. Had the drunken linguine and Thai ice tea. Great service as well.
author: Justin S.

description: My favorite neighborhood spot. Food is consistent. Staff is sweet. They also make the food so fast, which is perfect on the nights that I do not feel like cooking on my own  I've been coming here for years and will continue to do so.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Good choice for Thai food in the Lower Pac Heights area. Unpretentious, clean, and good quality food, nicely presented. Main dishes are around $10, appetizers start at $4. 

I only got to try the TOM KHA so far (cup: $4, bowl: $9) which was delightful with the right amount of shrimp and mushroom in it. The CHICKEN LETTUCE WRAPS ($8) came with a hot sauce and very delightful minced chicken. Awesome.

Came on a Friday night around 7pm, not too crowded.

The next day my stomach was growling and I'm most certain it came from the Thai food, couldn't pinpoint it enough though.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Worst place ever, the guy that  serves you is  rude and unprofessional. He argued with me concerning taking someone else payment while I was in line already to pay. But this other person was behind me in line.  Don't  eat here, unless you appreciate RUDE service. Usually I don't write but this one goes for the books. If there was a button for WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE this here wins.
author: mami m.

description: This is a great casual spot with fast service and kind employees.  Their green papaya salad is the best I have had since Thailand!
author: Cypris M.

description:
I used to go here for lunch a lot and thought that they had excellent service but they need to fix their online ordering system. Ordered from here online and was missing an important item with my curry... rice! They didn't even give me an option to get rice on the side. How am I suppose to know that the rice is a side order. Instead of apologizing they insisted that I should have known that I needed to ordered rice on the side when it wasnt an available option!

The food was good but the service puts it down to a star. Maybe they will be nicer when you are there sitting in at the restaurant.
author: Fanny C.

description:
So sad to find a bug in my favorite crispy calamari (see the picture attached! The crawly protein crisp comes fully intact: head, body, arms!). I shudder every time I think about it, whew, I just had a cold chill run down my spine! 
I am having a difficult time returning to purchase more of my favorite, spicy catfish and crispy calamari. Very concern that I will have a bug in my food again. I loved My Ivy. Unfortunately, I have to write this review. I hope their sanitation will improve and they will care about their customer's health and well being.
author: jenilyn l.

description: the staff here are very nice and friendly and personable. which is always a good thing. the food is not bad at all and the restaurent is warm and inviting and makes you feel safe and comfortable to spend your time. i have nothing negative to say about this place
author: Abigail S.

description: Fast service, good food. Can't go wrong. Been eating here for three years and it's consistently good. Usually quiet for lunch with good deals, so go then.
author: Loren K.

description: I ordered off Uber Eats the Tom Yum Soup and it arrived fast just taste was not to my likening. The soup was sweet which I definitely prefer my soup on the spicy side. They did include plenty of white meat chicken even though I'm pretty sure I ordered shrimp. Speedy delivery just lacking in taste of one of my favorite soups!
author: Aryn C.

description: I love this place! I'm not *super* picky about my Thai food, just FYI. But I've never had a meal here I didn't like and they are quick for takeout. Very great about accommodating little changes or extras I want. Nice staff! I've been getting the chicken noodle soup a lot. Also like the Pad Thai, and they have good Curry and rice dishes. Large portion size.
author: Emma B.

description: Good food. Quiet. Cozy little restaurant. I had the green curry and BBQ. It was good. I like there chicken BBQ. The curry was just a bit watery but still savory. All in all it was good I will go back there.
author: melissa a.

description: Bad customer service and mediocre Thai food. Can't recommend and won't be coming back.
author: Nic L.

description: We ordered pad see ew and drunken noodles with beef for delivery. Bland, pale and sad. Veggies were undercooked, noodles seemed over-cooked (slimy and mushy), beef was tough and unseasoned. Sauce was nonexistent. I can't say it tasted bad. Just tasted like nothing. Calamari and spring rolls were good though and delivery was fast. No idea what happened here. We will not be returning.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Wow, this place just recently opened and I must say, I am definitely a fan. It's a great Thai place. Came here during lunch, it wasn't too packed which was great. They offer a complimentary miso soup too! 

What I ordered for lunch: 
- Chicken Lettuce Wraps with minced chicken, water crest, carrot, fresh ginger, green onion served with lettuces. Really good and refreshing. It wasn't too heavy and the sauce adds a kick to it! 
- Spicy Catfish Spicy - crispy catfish wok tossed with eggplant, bell pepper and kaffir lime leaf in red curry coconut sauce topped with crispy basil. Definitely recommend this dish! The spiciness was just right and it is also one of the chef's choice! 

I will come back here again to try different dishes.
author: Jenn L.

description: I found this little place lovely. Great service, good selection of drinks and the food was delicious. You pretty much know what you're getting with Thai food, but I found this a little more special. Great food and atmosphere.
author: Kath L.

description: 3 stars at best. I ordered take out. The food tasted plain, the portions were small and it was overpriced.
author: Justin S.

description:
I love My Ivy Thai! Love it so much that I forget to review it for all the times I've been here.

A general review - the wait for food can be long or service slow sometimes because they are busy with to-go orders.

Call for a reservation (don't give up when they don't answer, when they do finally answer you can do s victory dance!) when dining with more than 4 people. This prepares the staff & kitchen.

Try the cocktails! Really will surprise you how flavorful the non-vodka drinks can be.

Every dish we ordered was fresh, flavorful & delicious.  Any errors made (special requests) are corrected quickly and graciously.

Our go-to dining when heading out for live music.
author: cailyn m.

description:
I am
Surpaies it doesn't have more stars! In all fairness I always order the same thing! Lol but if you like curry , they are great! Especially red curry, they out so many different vegetables, and they are never over cooked . You know it's good when the next day oil doesn't separate from the curry like some
Other places .
author: Anna B.

description: Very very rude employees!!  Made me feel very uncomfortable  also they are very slow I hate writing bad reviews but I do not like when people are rude!
author: Samuel S.

description: I think My Ivy is underrated. Everything I've had there is Delicious (see that capital "D"? I did that on purpose!), and the people there are so friendly! In particular, I like their Spicy Catfish, and their Pineapple Fried Rice, but so many other things on the menu are lovely as well. Do give them a try.
author: Eric H.

description: We had our dinner here yesterday. Good food and nice welcoming people. I was from Thailand originally so I asked the waitress to give me sth authentic for Thai tongue. It was good. My husband loved it.
author: Lana B.

description: Get the Ivy Best Friends or the Yellow Curry Shrimp. That sweet and sour sauce is delicious. Be sure order a Thai iced tea!
author: Jesse-James B.

description: Ordered one of their fried rice to go for lunch. Very delicious but their ratio of veggies to rice was off with too many veggies. Have yet to have a bad Thai experience so this is on par with many other Thai restaurants.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
Every time I come here for lunch the workers are friendly and the service is super quick. I haven't had to wait super long for a seat but this place can get super crowded during lunch time as it is smaller cozy establishment in a super busy neighborhood with about 20 tables or so. 

They are pretty quick to with the phone orders too as several co- workers order from here frequently and if they have it delivered, its normally to our shop within 20 minutes for delivery which is great.
author: Sara C.

description: I was passing by it and decided to try and it was sooo good n yummy! And it got ready super fast me and my friend were shook!
author: Roxane O.

description: Terrible Thai food. We were shocked at all the positive reviews. We ordered take out via Door Dash, which was quick and efficient. However, the quality of the food was awful. The massaman curry was bland at best. What we really didn't like is that they just spoon the sauce over the tofu and veggies instead of stewing the tofu in the curry. Most of the tofu was still bland and white and raw. The pad seew was not rich in sauce or flavor, again bland and not satisfying. The only thing we really enjoyed were the veggie spring rolls. Will not eat here again.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
So delicious!!! The veggies were fresh, the tofu was so tasty! Great unobtrusive service.
Nice soothing atmosphere. Loved the fresh rolls elegantly served in a long platter with base of peanut sauce.   I order the yellow curry at most any Thai restaurant I visit and this was one of the best I've ever tasted.
High quality vegetables. My friend thought the Thai iced tea was too sweet and too much cloves.
author: Mimi B.

description:
The place looked innocuous and was mostly deserted when we doubled in from the train. We'd been arguing about where. To go: I wanted new, he wanted one block down.

I don't know exactly what I wanted but I needed His complaining to end. And once he'd supped the CoMplimentary  Thai Tea that  was (free with Yelp check in) he became less bear ish.

For mains I chose the pumpkin curry with. Tofu. It can. In's rich red a sauce, horn enough to make my nose water, and. I used chop sticks to remOve broccoli and carrot pieces from the stew.

My starter was excitingly unusual, vegetable rolls like I'd never seen. Them before, delicately laid up right on the plate with a thick peanut dipping sauce that was both rich and airy at the same time.

Truly, a hidden gem.
author: Zara S.

description:
Closest Thai place to my house. They are very quick for take out. 

Not the BEST I've ever had but great in a pinch. My go-to is the Chicken Pad Thai (sometimes amazing sometimes weak. I think it depends on who's cooking it that night so it's a gamble people) and yellow curry sub veggies. 

Pumpkin and green curry tasty too!
author: Rachel T.

description:
I got delivery from Eat24/Yelp. 

Before I even get my food, the delivery guy says "You owe me cash!" 
I was confused as I thought I selected the credit card option. He shows me the receipt and I see "TIP:Cash".
I ask him to wait out here while I see if I have any cash.
After frantically looking for a $5, I couldn't find any cash. I apologize and let him know that I don't have any cash. He rolls his eyes and storms off. 

The food wasn't any better. The yellow curry was watery and bland. There was no flavor The BBQ Pork was decent but may have been undercooked. The spring rolls fell apart.

With so many Thai options in SF, I probably won't order from them again.
author: Enoch L.

description:
Service was quick and attentive. The food was amazing! 

We ordered the pad Thai, the papaya salad with BBQ chicken. In addition to the excellent Thai iced coffee. When we return to SF, we will also be returning here!
author: Jesika P.

description: Horribly boring and flavorless chicken noodle soup. How there was no lime, cilantro, jalapeños or anything that would bring this soup to some life is beyond me. Basically just noodles and chicken broth. Portion was also small given the price. Very disappointed.
author: Zach C.

description: Apparently, at this place you're required to pay a tip even though you thought the service was awful. I tip based on how much money is available and service. My last delivery had terribly rude service and they took my food away because I wouldn't give them a tip. Last time I checked, tips weren't required.
author: Samantha S.

description: Ordered a pad Thai and Thai iced tea to go. Pad Thai had no flavor and they didn't give me a fork, napkin, and straw.
author: J C.

description:
Why they lost a star: The thai iced tea (free with check in) was on the sweet side so I had to let the ice melt a little and there was more veggies in this dish than most places I normally go to. 

Came in here during my 1 hour lunch break to grab a to-go order of drunken noodles (pad kee mao), a personal favorite, and a thai ice tea. The staff was quick and the wait for food was not long (I ordered when I walked in) maybe a 5-10 minuet wait. The dish had more veggies than I'm used to and had slightly less noodles in it but they had bamboo pieces which made up for it. There was also plenty of meat and the sauce was seasoned just right. It wasn't bland or salty and had a tiny spicy kick to it. It was the perfect amount for lunch and maybe they have bigger portions during dinner. The thai iced tea was good and slightly on the sweet side, but the key thing to note is that they did not water it down!!! It was creamy with a black tea taste and how thai tea should taste.
author: Maybo H.

description: The spring rolls were amazing as well as the papaya  BBQ chicken salad. Boyfriend got the yellow curry, some of the best in the city! The portions were generous , but of great quality. We will be back soon!
author: Kiara M.

description: I had the tom kha noodle soup chicken. It was good. Had a good amount of chicken compared to other places about 3 oz and about 2 c noodles.
author: April A.

description: Delicious Tom Yum soup and spring rolls.  It never looks crowded and so I've avoided it in the past, but that was a mistake as it's really good!  I won't hesitate to go back.
author: Janelle F.

description:
First and foremost - what a fantastic deal on interesting cocktails like a Lychee martini - $5! Whoopee, even this cheap old gal can order a cocktail at that price.
 
I'll start by saying I never say "let's go out for Thai food" but I might start saying that now...
 
The entrees hover around $10 and they are HUGE. We stuffed ourselves and really had an entire other portion to take home. Ordered a beef curry and the pad thai, and aside of steamed veggies (for $3.50). We also ordered 1 rice, but I saw some red rice going buy that looked better - I will inquire next time.  $38 for 2 cocktails, 2 entrees, 2 sides (rice and veggies) - that seems like quite a deal considering it served 2 of us with a huge leftover portion.
 
One table over was raving about the fried banana and coconut ice cream.  Next time we are in for that.
 
I will suggest they turn down their phone ringer - so loud and they can't seem to get to the phone in time - so people call (RING RING RING RING RING RING RING RING RING - the gal finally goes to answer it- but too late no one there - she walks away, and then the process repeats...and repeats, and repeats)  I can't imagine they get much repeat take out business ;)
author: Amy W.

description: First time to this place, very authentic Thai cuisine. Came all the way from east bay and it was worth driving. Their dessert is must try. Will go back again.
author: DJ J.

description:
Nice and clean restaurant. We were seated right away and our waiter (i think he was the only one working on a Sunday afternoon) took care of us and checked in with us frequently.

My husband and I had crab Rangoon appetizers that were delicious! I had the fried chicken fried rice and my husband had duck stew. Our orders came out promptly and we were able to get free thai tea each for checking in on yelp, which was also perfect, not too sweet. 

The restaurant itself is on a quiet corner and they also participate in GrubHub, and they give you 5% off coupons for your next order. Food is decently priced and service is great.
author: Jenny M.

description: We ordered Mango salad, curry noodle soup with shrimp and red curry chicken with BBQ chicken over rice for lunch, we like all of them, very delicious .
author: Barabara W.

description: Live close by - great for takeout! Yellow curry is bomb and so is the calamari. Recommend when you are in rush. Also have $6 cocktails if you eat in which is a decent deal in SF
author: Rob S.

description: Ambiance is nice, the waitress was very attentive, and our dishes were delicious at an affordable price!!
author: East B.

description: I love My Ivy! So fresh and tons of flavor, not greasy. It's my favorite Thai spot in SF. My go-to's: chicken lettuce wraps, Thai curry dumplings, crab fried rice, pad see ew. But everything is good here! Oh and if you eat in, they serve Sauvignon Blanc in a frosty wine glass!
author: Sondra O.

description:
Not sure why this place got such high ratings but we stopped here for Sunday dinner after visiting with my BFF from LA and her mom.  
It's not a particularly large restaurant and it was quiet for a Sunday.
The 4 of us spent about $50 for the following:
1. Tom Yum noodle soup $10.  I really wanted Tom Yum soup but it was not on their menu but later, I found it on their printed take out menu!  I really didn't like this soup.
Hubby usually hates this soup because he finds it too sour.  The soup here was too sweet (Really, who makes a SWEET Tom Yum soup?) and not sour enough - it is per Hubby, who doesn't even like this dish in general.  Would not order again.  And, the soup came AFTER our entrees arrived.  There was a lot of chicken pieces in it and lots of noodles, the thin rice noodle kind.  Should've tried the Angel wings instead.

2. Crispy chicken with egg fried rice, $9.  The chicken had a nice crispy crust and wasn't bad, the rice looked and tasted like plain white rice with some egg mixed into it.  I have to say the chicken is better than that at Chabaa on Irving (their food has gone downhill).
I would try this again.

3. Green Curry chicken, $10.50.  The sauce was so thin, it was like a bowl of soup, extremely watery.  Some vegts in it, occasional eggplant, chicken.  But, I thought it lacked flavor and Hubby was surprised it had more heat in it for a "mild" dish.  I wouldn't order this again. A small bowl of white Jasmine rice to accompany this was $2.00.
I prefer the curry dishes at Chaya in West Portal instead. 

4. Thai fried rice - $9.  Was OK.  

Over all, food wasn't up to my standards.  Hands down, I would rather spend the extra money and go to Marnee Thai and even Osha Thai's food tastes better in my opinion even 'tho it's a chain.
author: Ry T.

description: It should be noted that if you're ordering delivery, rice is not an automatic accompaniment. While it may be included at lunch, these spongy kernels a is not part of the meal in the evening hours. Obviously for ease of digestion- for which we can all be grateful.
author: Mark M.

description: It's great that they're quick to deliver, but I ended up paying $17 for green curry that didn't come with rice and only had one piece of eggplant. Super disappointed and not worth the quick delivery.
author: angela l.

description:
I used to frequent this place while I worked on a project at UCSF Mt Zion.
I ordered one of their soups, there was a ROACH floating in it, only I found it after a couple of bite....yuck.
I let the server know and he looked at me and treated me like I put that roach in my soup.
I wasn't even rude.
They were rude and only offered to get me a new one. Really?!?!? Why would I want the same thing, the whole family of roaches may be doing laps in the pot.
Never again, so gross. 
I walk to get Thai food elsewhere.
author: Natasha C.

description: Very reasonable prices and FAST service. I get them to go all the time and it's always ready in 10 min with no mistakes. Pretty good Thai food too!
author: Haley P.

description:
Dear My Ivy Thai food,

I really wanted to like you but your food is terrible.
I have tried several items and the results are always somewhere in between horrified and sadly disappointed.
Your Tom Yum soup is too sweet.
author: Melissa B.

description:
I recently had their Salmon basil for $14.25 and I have to say it was disgusting. They burned the salmon with the grill marks and let me tell you it was black. It gave the entire piece a very unpleasant smell and taste rendering it inedible. The veggies it was with were supposed to be onion, bell pepper and mushroom in garlic chili sauce but I got mainly some kind of eggplant which I hate and a few onions mushrooms and peppers. I had to throw the entire dish away. If I had eaten there I would have sent it back to the kitchen. I did not taste garlic chili or basil and have no idea what the sauce was. It was a very poor presentation and the veggies were even way over cooked. There was nothing about that dish that was any good. 
I give them 2 stars because the spring rolls I had were very good and I've had a salad there before that was also good. I do not think I will order off the chef recommendations again. Maybe I'll stick to uncooked fresh items.
author: Kay W.

description:
We live right down the block, so this has become our go-to Thai place within walking distance.  We've ordered from them several times (once for delivery) and the order has always been 100% correct (and for the one time we ordered delivery, it arrived quickly).

The food has always been pretty good. Ingredients seem fresh, flavors are strong (the curries, rices, and meat entrees), and the appetizers are pretty good (golden calamari, salmon rolls). Prices are acceptable and surprisingly average (given this is San Francisco and everything's overpriced here). The 4 or 5 times we've dined in the restaurant, the ambiance has been fine and feels a bit more upscale than your average Thai restaurant. We enjoy eating here and it supports our local, neighborhood businesses.
author: Nicholas T.

description:
Pricey for Thai food, but considering that it's in the lower pac heights area it's expected. I've come here for both take-out and dine-in for lunch since it's close to my work. It's about $8-10 for their lunch specials. The service can be slow sometimes during the lunch rush, but if you order via phone you can just walk on over and it'll be ready instantly. There's no place to wait inside so when it's crowded it's best to just get in and get out.

+ Fave Eats:
-BBQ chicken & papaya salad - comes with rice and a side of sweet and sour sauce; one of the best lunch dishes here in my opinion. Though there are times when the salad tastes like they put too much fish sauce/lime.
-Pad thai w/ your choice of meat/tofu
-Lemon grass chicken w/ veggies and rice

The curries are just okay in my opinion. They don't give you very much of the vegetables. Also, I can barely detect the "spiciness" that some of their dishes indicate, maybe our definitions are not the same seeing as how I love sichuan/korean/mexican food to the point of having to pop an omeprazole before heartburn sets in. Oh, and there was a beef and string bean dish I had ordered one time that was just so awful...way too heavy on the peanut sauce. You've been warned.

Overall I'd only come here if I'm inkling for Thai food and stuck in the area for a good while.
author: Loriel L.

description: Good Food Good Service...Nice mellow music playing. Big screen tea with sports channel on.
author: Valerie S.

description:
*****This review is for their delivery services******

My coworkers and I had a cankering for thai food and we chose to order from My Ivy. I ordered the green curry but switched out the chicken for eggplant, another green curry with chicken, and another pad see ew with extra egg. All of the orders came to our workplace A-OK, EXCEPT FOR MINE ----- that would happen to me -___- My green curry had the correct broth, but it literally was like a vegetable curry WITHOUT eggplants. It had broccoli (so strange), bamboo shoots (normal), carrots (meh), HELLA CABBAGE (NO ME THINKS NOT). 

My coworkers swear by this place, so I'm going to dine-in, one of these days. But for now, the 2 stars are there to stay.
author: Kathleene E.

description: Delicious food and nice wine selection! Not overly spicy or rich like so much Thai food I've had. Try the crispy tofu starter! Easy parking on the street. My new favorite Thai place.
author: Lori S.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to Ivy for dinner on a Friday night, and were surprised to find it all but empty (although it was almost nine). That said, the atmosphere was still fine, as the lighting was good and the restaurant looked like it had been recently remodeled.  There were some beautiful modern fixtures and art, and the tables were cleanly set. Top 40 hits played from a radio, which sounded a bit scratchy, but at least they were making an effort. 

The service was fast and a bit rushed; it was only an hour before closing. The server was friendly though and was very accommodating of my requests for vegetable substitutions and fried tofu. We ordered crispy spring rolls to start, followed by pad see ew and pumpkin curry, with a side of white rice. 

I was surprised to find when I took a sip of water that the glasses were plastic. Dining from plastic isn't what I would call magical, as I don't even use plastic cups at home. I dislike the lack of weight and clinking sound, and the odd mouthfeel. Maybe this makes me a snob?

The spring rolls were perfectly crisp and had a nice mixture of vermicelli and vegetables inside. I really enjoyed the sour sauce that accompanied them too, so much so that I was using it as a dip for the crunch rice noodles they sprinkled on the plate for garnish. It was so tasty I could have drank it! The spring rolls were larger than usual, so I felt almost full after eating two of them. You could easily order them as a meal, so it was a good value. 

While waiting for our food, we had to suffer through a commercial break (radio), which was a mood killer. The music returned just in time for our entrées. The pad see ew was prepared with carrots, instead of broccoli, as I had requested, which I appreciated. Unfortunately, the noodles were very overcooked and stuck together, like they had been in sitting in water for too long after taken off boil. The portion was huge, but we barely ate it because of the noodles and the beef, which was tough and chewy. I would NOT recommend this dish.

The pumpkin curry was delicious. The curry base had the right amount of spice, was rich and creamy, and full of flavor. I ate tons of rice just to have more curry sauce. I enjoyed the pumpkin and veggies in the curry too, although they were cut in very large pieces. It would be easier to enjoy if the veggies were more bite-sized, especially since chopsticks are the best for cutting things smaller. 

Overall, My Ivy Thai seems like it has potential to be a good restaurant. The staff is sweet, the curry is tasty, and the interior is polished. There is some real work that needs to be done in terms of food consistency and attention to detail. And they need to invest in a music service, or at least stream a commercial-free channel!
author: Mars W.

description:
Some people's reviews are hilarious! This place is a good thai restaurant. If you feel it's too expensive, go to Taco Bell on Geary or get a higher paying job. Do you plp understand that commercial rents ESP in nice are the business owners biggest cost. These people are not trying to rip you off, they are trying to stay afloat. 

Getting your Togo order messed up is frustrating, I agree. Then don't order Togo. Dine in. Togo orders are tougher and more of a pain for the employees. I wouldn't expect you to know that because the ones that are complaining have NEVER worked on a restaurant.   

The food is good. That's it guys! 

Name me more than 5 better thai places .... U can't.
author: steve a.

description:
Randomly found this place while looking for a quick lunch. The restaurant looks quite fancy but the prices are very fair. I ordered a pad thai and the people I was with ordered the lunch special which came with beef ribs and curry and the other person ordered the Pad See Ew. 

The Pad See Ew was the best of the three. The pad thai tasted average. A little bland for my taste. The beef ribs were good but really fatty and the curry was tasty but nothing outstanding. For dessert I ordered the fried banana with ice cream. It was delicious! 

Overall, quite fancy dishes and the prices are cheap for what you get. However, not the best tasting thai food and the service is mediocre.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Great Thai restaurant in Pacific Heights area. Food and service are both good. Especially like the Spicy Catfish!
author: Neha M.

description: i like the ease of this place, the price and the lack of pretension.  The food is really more 3-star - it's good but not outstanding.  But when you figure in what value is there it pops up to 4 stars.
author: EE S.

description:
This is a review for the My Ivy delivered.  It was a totally exhausting day and we couldn't face cooking.  My husband went off to solve some final workday problems and my job was to have great Thai delivery at the door in a reasonable amount of time .  

Our usual Thai favorites are only available for pick-up or eat-in, and we're relatively new to this neighborhood, so after browsing Yelp awhile I settled on My Ivy.   So glad we did - the delivery time was about 15 minutes faster than I was expecting, the order (it was a BIG one) was perfect, no mistakes, and everything was hot and fresh.  

We ordered Spicy String Beans, Pumpkin Curry with Tofu, Green Curry with Calamari, fresh spring rolls, and pineapple fried rice, plus brown and coconut rice.  Loved getting a free Thai Iced Tea!  The spice was great - our dishes ranged from moderate to very spicy. Great flavors overall. 

The only thing I didn't totally love were the spring rolls. They were good, but too much lettuce for me, and a bit bland, the peanut dipping sauce was OK - I'm not a fan in general of peanut dipping sauce though - My Ivy's wasn't any worse than anyone else's, it just didn't improve the flavor of the spring rolls, which were fresh but, well, lettucey.  

We'll definitely work My Ivy into our ordering out rotation.  Solid!
author: Sandra M.

description: I didn't realize how much I love this place until they closed for a week to remodel! I panicked! I tried a few places while the were closed and was disappointed each time. The food is fresh and consistent, and service is always great.I'm so glad that they are back and I'll remain a loyal customer.
author: Shawna R.

description: Their Tom Kha Gai is sweet savory and one of my absolute favorites! Staff is on point!
author: Pete A.

description: There food is good! Besides the fact that I had a piece of hair in my Tum Yum soup :(
author: Jazmine P.

description:
At this point, only sampling two dishes and two deserts, it's more like 3.5 stars, but we would definitely return to try other dishes.

This place was nearly empty when we came in on a Sunday around 3:30 PM. Just a couple of people were seated. So service was fairly quick (just one person was manning the phone, serving tables and taking our orders). We had two dishes, an appetizer, and two deserts and liked the deserts best.

The appetizer, Golden Calamari, was our least favorite. The calamari was tough, and was served under a glaze of a too sweet Thai smoked chili paste. For calamari, less would have been more: they should have been served straight up with the sauces on the side for dipping if needed. And the quality of the calamari itself could really been improved by not overcooking them.

The Pineapple Fried Rice was good. Kind of a Singapore curry flavor going on, with slices of chicken, and chunks of pineapple with onions and cashews, but we did not have an "OMG, this is amazing" kind of moment. We had such a large serving that we took most of this home.

We also had their dish that they called "Ivy Best Friends" which are three things served together but separated: Boneless BBQ Chicken (thigh served dry), shredded green papaya salad, and a black sticky rice served with a thin sweet and sour sauce. Separately these items were OK (the crispy-skinned chicken was a bit on the dry side for a thigh) but really were at their best when mixed, all the different textures of sweet, sour, crunchy, chewy, tangy, cold and hot were all represented in this dish. 

The execution of this entree might have been better if the chicken were more juicy and had more inherent flavor, but this dish had a great potential to be an eye-opening lesson on why Thai food is so good at combining so many textures and tastes into their wondrous cuisine.

The deserts were the stand-out for us: Mango Sticky Rice and Fried Banana with coconut Ice Cream. 

The sticky rice was amazing: this warm short-grained white rice was so dense and chewy that it seemed like it was on its way to being mochi, covered in a thick, sweet coconut milk. This was perfectly offset by mango slices that were not too sweet, so they complemented the rice's sweet stickiness with a firm cold tartness.

The Fried Bananas were coated in a perfectly crisped batter that was not oily and were perfectly sweet. Again those many textures: cold sweet coconut ice cream, crunchy warm and sweet banana fritters--just heaven in a spoon.

We would definitely visit this place again to check out their other main dishes.
author: Glenn H.

description:
I've sampled a few things from their menu and I'm happy to keep ordering, especially since the food is very good, they deliver & their price point is gentle, especially for the quality.

Having had both the Drunken noodles and Crispy chicken and egg rice entrees, choose the chicken: The drunken noodles were spicy and flavorful but needed more sauce and definitely more vegetables and straw (instead of too-thin slices of shitake) mushrooms. 

A note: If My Ivy made Drunken noodles as well as Portland's Appe-thai-zing then I'd be ordering from My Ivy every other night. Can you steal their recipe - please (I'm begging you!)  You'd really have a dish no other Thai restaurant in San Francisco has been able to duplicate anywhere close to Appe-thai-zing's (and I've tried quite a few).

I digress...

My Ivy's appetizer of almond prawns accompanied by a delicious creamy lemon dipping sauce was heaven. While the angel wings were yummy, the almond prawns are the way to go. It's a sensational appetizer I've never seen on any other menu so for me, it had that pop of trying something new and it was delectable.

And a thumbs up on My Ivy's crab rangoons. Here, My Ivy's delicate yet flavorful spices really stepped up this delicious (and decadent) appetizer.  

I would give My Ivy 4.5 stars if I could since the second time I ordered I asked if they put me higher up on the delivery rounds and they did. I requested specifically since the first time I ordered, my food had arrived disappointingly lukewarm. 

And the second time, My Ivy got it right.

I'm looking forward to trying their soups and definitely one of their curry dishes.

My Ivy dishes great Thai comfort food, inventively spiced and perfect for a rainy night or at the end of a long week and the price point is just right.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Great spicy edamame, more garlicky than spicy, but very good. The pad see ew was pretty bland and dry, did not keep well as leftover. However, the fried rice definitely made up for noodles
author: Bryanna M.

description: Super dissatisfied with my order of Tom Kha soup and pad see ew I just had delivered. It has absolutely no flavor and I even specifically requested it to be spicy. This is the blandest Thai food I've ever had in my life. The only good thing about this place was how fast it was delivered but that's understandable because they forgot to add in the ingredients that give it any taste. So annoyed, it's not even edible.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Absolutely horrible!
Tried this place for the first time and it was a huge disappointment. Ordered takeout and the Papaya salad was overly doused in chili flakes with no real flavor. Pad Thai, Thai fried rice and lemongrass chicken were all extremely bland with little to no flavor! After paying $45 for this lackluster meal, I feel like I want to call and ask for my money back. Will never ever order from here again.
author: Mary B.

description:
Is an update necessary if it was perfect the first time... and perfect the seventh time? Hmm, let us ponder. 

Fresh Spring Rolls - FANTASTIC. Yummy peanut sauce, fresh, non-wilted greens, crunchy carrots, and flavorful tofu. Throw in their beautiful display and it certainly puts a spring in my step! 

Spicy Basil Leaf - ummm better every time I order it. That's a pretty major feat. Spicy, fresh, colorful, and frolicking with flavor, this dish remains a fave. 

Pumpkin Curry - I have a crush on pumpkin. There's something about that cute little stem poking out the top, the shiny skin oozing with beta-carotene, and don't even get me started on those touchable vertical curves... It started with carving and seed roasting on Halloweens, matured with Burma Superstar's Pumpkin Shrimp, and has now reached unconditional status with My Ivy's Pumpkin Curry. Love... 

Our waitress was phenomenal. She saved us from some potentially drastic ordering mistakes. When trying to sub fresh tofu for fried, this lovely lady kindly informed us that "it's gross" with the fresh. Who knew?! I know we all comment on service... but even compared to any fancy shmancy, hoity toity restaurant, this place wins hands, feet, and butt down (butt down on decorative chairs!). #1 for perfect waitressing. 

Question: 
Why are plates and bowls circular? Let us consider the evolution of circular dishware. Did it begin with drift wood - rounded corners from years sand wear and tear? Maybe the pelvic bone of some animal, shaped to cup some fluids or random prehistoric mush. Whatever the original reason for round dishes, rest assured it's worthless now! My Ivy is going 21st century on us and whippin' out some square ones. I guarantee it holds your foods just as well. 

So tell me, was a review update necessary? Do you stop watering a perfect flower? Stop encouraging a straight A student? Stop brushing a cavity-less mouth? It. Was. Necessary.
author: Zoey S.

description: I love this place. The food is incredible. Nice quiet joint. I recommend the salmon basil and the curry. I don't always love rice,but the wild rice and sticky rice have awesome consistency. Just tried Thai Sukiyaki for the first time- their take on pad wood sen- and it is delicious and very fresh.
author: Samantha H.

description: good stuff, just made it before they closed for lunch. hot, fresh & delicious was my "spicy eggplant" dish, I also had a prawn noodle thing that was delivering the heat. I'll go back again as it's close to where I work out.
author: Henry K.

description:
This place is definitely fancier than any other thai restraunt I have ever been to! And a different thing they do is give you a little soup appetizer, like the miso soup of Thailand! It is quite good and tasty!

I ordered a pad thai and I feel that it was definitely not saucy enough and too sweet :(

My mom got the pumpkin curry with rice and the portions were too small! 

My friend got a papaya salad and she was dying of how spicy it was but maybe it was just her haha!

I would not come here again though just because I don't think I want to come here for thai when there are so many other thai place
author: Megan L.

description: A friend and I came today to try My Ivy out for the first time.  We got there at 2pm so there were only 2 other tables taken.  She ordered the Pad Thai and I had the Pumpkin Curry with chicken.  Pad Thai was $8.50 and the curry was $9.  I liked the Pad Thai the best, but have nothing to complain about.  Wish the portions were a liiiitle more generous.  The free Thai iced tea through Yelp was nice :)
author: Amanda J.

description:
My Ivy Thai Restaurant is pretty Americanized but that doesn't mean the food is bad.  The Pumpkin Curry ($10) caught my eye so I had to order it.  It's a pretty big bowl filled with chunks of pumpkin and veggies all sitting in a creamy soup. The aroma was amazing and I couldn't wait to dive in.  Definitively delivered everything to my taste buds...

Make sure to order a side of rice for $1.50 since the dish doesn't come with rice.
author: Stacey P.

description:
So last week I decided to order to go from My Ivy.  I ordered the tofu pad thai, papaya salad, fresh spring rolls, and chicken fried rice.  When I got home I noticed I received tofu fried rice instead of chicken fried rice.  Normally I wouldn't mind the mistake since the tofu fried rice wasn't that bad but since I live close by, I decided to call them to correct the order.  When I called and spoke with the waitress, she read back the correct order so it wasn't like she took the order wrong, it was more so they just made the wrong item.  She told me to come back and when I showed her the tofu fried rice, she took it and gave me the death stare as if I made the mistake.  As if that wasn't bad enough, she gave me more attitude when she gave me the correct order.  Please tell me how it was my fault to get so much attitude???

In a nutshell, the food was OK at best but the customer service was freaking horrible since I didn't even get an apology or anything.  I won't be going back ever again.
author: Derek Y.

description: Order take out from here quite a bit. This place is very prompt in their service-which I appreciate. I love their Tom Yum soup and Mango salad. My only gripe is that their spice isn't very consistent.
author: Tanya L.

description:
I decided to give this place another try before reviewing it. That's not to say I didn't have a good experience here the first time (both times I've eaten here it's been takeout), it was just that I ordered something kind of plain so I figured I'd order something more "exciting" before reviewing it. 

The first time I ordered here I got crispy chicken w/fried rice, and it was good! I wasn't sure exactly what to expect, but it was simpler than I thought it would be. It was literally just fried rice (w/nothing else mixed in) and pieces of lightly breaded chicken. There was a light sweet sour & sauce on the side. The thing is, I LIKED that it was simple. I also liked that neither the chicken or sauce was all that heavy (and that the sauce came on the side). 

The second time I ordered from here I got Drunken noodles, which were also yummy! They were garlicky (but not to heavy) w/lots of veggies mixed in. Again, this dish was fairly light, and pretty simple, which is something I liked. 

Even though I got takeout I noticed this place does do delivery (I think there's a $20 minimum). I didn't get to experience the restaurant itself that much, but it seems nice and the staff seems friendly. I like that there's now a Thai option in this area to go along w/all the other casual dining spots (Tortilla Heights & Godzilla to name a couple). 

This place doesn't have website (that I know of anyway) so both times when ordering I looked at the menu from GrubHub (I've STILL forgotten to grab a menu from the restaurant), and both times my meals came out a little cheaper than the prices listed there, so that's good! In general, My Ivy is very reasonable price wise. The portions aren't huge, but satisfying enough. I'll be back!
author: George A.

description: I live right down the street and get take out all the time. I LOVE the curry dumplings, yum yum. Those with a side of rice are easily a full meal. I usually, however, get veggie tofu pad se ew. I'm not a cabbage fan and have asked them to give me little to no cabbage and DELISH. I will always go to my corner Thai spot and I always crave it :)
author: Sophia F.

description:
Good spot to go grab thai food for lunch.  I had walked by several times during the lunch hour and it never seemed very busy, but it had decent reviews on yelp, so the lady and I decided to give it a try.

Good lunch menu with several solid options in the $8-9 range.  I had the pumpkin curry which was really tasty, and the girlfriend enjoyed some extra spicy chicken pad thai, which was good, but not great.  Best thai food I've found thus far in Lower Pac Heights, but I'm sure there's something superiour out there that I haven't found yet though.  Cozy little place with a decent enough decor that it could quality as a date-night retaurant should you want Thai food for dinner.

I'll return to My Ivy any time I want thai food for lunch somewhere in lower Pac Heights, a solid little spot.
author: Kyle S.

description:
If you've got Connect 4, Scrabble, UNO, whatever... bring it. My friend and I played several rounds while waiting for stuff like having our orders taken, the food arriving, and getting checked on by our servers. We showed up on a Monday evening with something like 3/4 of the tables occupied and two friendly servers present. It was one of those "Hey, what's that place we just drove by? Let's try it." things for us.

Compared to some other SF Thai restaurants, the interior is slightly more modern and upscale (but not like the Osha on 3rd St or at the Embarcadero). I appreciate that, given the setting, the vibe is still chill enough to walk in head-to-toe in sweats or Lululemon, or football (soccer) scrimmage gear like a pair two tables down from us. But don't let any of this stop you from putting on your sportcoat or that little black number.

Of note among our particular items were the Black and White Sticky Rice, Strawberry Mojito, and Pumpkin Curry. I haven't seen the B&W rice on other menus. It came in a small foil wrap and had parts that were slightly crunchy. About the crunch factor, think a number of levels lower than the rice at the bottom of a Korean hot stone bowl. Actually, I'd say they weren't "crunchy" so much as "not as soft as you'd expect rice to be". The non-alcohol tones of the Strawberry Mojito were like Kool-Aid, if that's your thing. My friend liked the Pumpkin Curry as good as or better than others they'd had; it was overall too sweet for me.

According to one of our servers, the food here is intentionally California-ized. So if you're seeking the intense and traditional, My Ivy might not be Your Ivy, per se. Given the ambience though, I shouldn't have to spell that out for you while racking up double and triple word scores.
author: Dan B.

description: I tried calling but I couldn't get an answer. I was violently ill with explosive diarrhea on the way home from lunch today. We had the mussels coconut soup and I think the mussels were bad. I'm still sick from this lunch. This was a bad choice.
author: cathleen d.

description: Ordered yellow curry and pad thai to go from here for dinner. I felt sick for the entire day the next day so I figured the food was probably just too spicy and was upsetting my stomach. Turns out my friend was feeling sick the whole day too so there was definitely something wrong with the food. Very unlikely that we will be coming back here or recommending this place to anyone with so many other Thai options in the area.
author: Maryann S.

description:
Great local Thai place.
Great pad thai, pad see ew, pineapple fried rice, and pumpkin curry.
Friendly and fast.
Easy to find parking.
I often order takeout too!
Need I see more? 
I don't feel like being too creative.
It's good. Try it.
The end.
author: Heidy S.

description:
Not a bad Thai place. This is only for delivery.

Was craving some Thai and since I've seen this place off Divis so many times, I became curious so went ahead and got some delivery.

Ordered beef with basil (Gra pow), chicken pad see ew, and lychee shrimp.

Well cooked and sweet like I like it.

Then I read an article in the latest "Atlantic" which discouraged me from going to Thai places... Oh well. Would order again.
author: Julia P.

description:
Promising place with great ambiance!  There always seems to be a spot open if you decide to dine here cause its never overly crowded.  Great spot for a big group of people. 

As for the food, I think every dish I had was pretty good but not the best.  You can definitely get better Thai in SF.  My favorite is the pumpkin curry which is essentially red curry with pumpkin.  Delicious!
author: Nho C.

description:
+3 stars for solid entries in the 'Yellow Curry w- Chicken' and 'Pumpkin Curry w- Tofu' departments. 

Do not sleep on enjoying the Fresh Spring Rolls. You've been told, troop.
author: Mark S. I.

description: First time here and the food is delicious! I came in for a quick bite during my break from work and I was seated quickly. I tried their grilled chicken seaweed salad and their veggie rolls. Both were really good, the salad was on the spicy side but that's the way I like it. Definitely going to be one of my pit stops for a bite from now on.
author: Kaisar A.

description:
I had lunch at "My Ivy" today with a group of my international friends.  I m Thai, btw. We had a great time and will definitely come back again.  Love simple yet elegant decoration.  Even though, it is relatively a small place, It does feel very open and has a lot of natural light coming from the wrap around windows. I think it makes the dinning experience even more pleasant.  The staffs were nice and friendly. 

We ordered a bunch of different dishes.  My fav were "Golden Calamari" 
"Salmon Rolls" "Papaya Salad" and "Seafood fried rice"  The food tasted fantastic. Dishes were decorated beautifully.  Portions were very reasonable.  Dont worry about coming home hungry if u decide to dine at this new place.    Ending the meal with yummy dessert, Love Love Love "Mango Panna cotta" ; creamy with a little sweet and sour taste to it.  1 wasnt enough.

I totally recommend this place ^^
author: Pattie G.

description:
Meh.  I had pad se ew.  It was solid and priced under $10, but nothing to write home to momma about.  

Solid food.  Nothing more, nothing less.  I recommend because it's under $10 for entree.

Servers were shy or uninterested as well.  But it was not busy so that didn't impact my experience too much.
author: Charlie B.

description: The ivy beef is so good. It is tender and I will come back again. Highly recommended.
author: Dong A.

description:
Been here many times and it's a really good place for Thai food. It's probably my favorite Thai restaurant in the city.

The best items I've had here are:

- Pad kee mao (drunken noodles)  
- Curry Noodle Soup
- Aromatic Duck (with steamed small rice noodle)
- Tom Yum Noodle Soup

The different curries are also pretty good. 

So so items:
- Tom Kha noodle soup (coconut noodle soup)
- Steak salad

I would not hesitate to come back when craving Thai food. Prices are also very reasonable.
author: Ali F.

description: I love this place and continue to try something new every time. Gotta recommend the Ivy Beef and Carmelized Duck. The Golden Calamari may be the best calamari I have ever had.
author: Chris B.

description:
I had a friend in the city visiting so I came by to meet her for lunch.

We needed a place close to where she was staying and chose this place.

We split the crab rangoon and mixed veggies with brown rice.

The crab rangoon were fresh and well made, the filling was good and flavorful.

The mixed veggies we just ok, the chicken was a bit dry and there was more cabbage than anything else in the mixed veggies. No amazing special flavor in the sauce.

It is a simple nice place, friendly staff but the food just was not special enough for me.
author: Sean A.

description: This place is amazing, I have never been disappointed. We have got the yellow curry, pumpkin curry, pineapple and lychee curry and calamari and been impressed each time! Make sure you order the coconut rice too!
author: Joanna W.

description:
I love this place! I eat here at least once a month and have never had anything negative to say about the food (takeout or eat-in) the service, the cleanliness or the staff.

The green curry with brown rice and the pad see ew are my two favorite items but I also really love the spicy green beans (add shrimp) and recently tried the Tom Kha and it was heavenly. 

They have some unique items like pineapple trout. I tried it and it came as a whole fish, eyes skin and everything. It was delicious as well.

You really can't go wrong with this place, take out or dine in.
author: Robyn M.

description: I've ordered from My Ivy probably over a dozen times. It never fails to disappoint. The food always has a lot of flavor, they're quick on delivery, and it satisfies my thai food cravings. No complaints about My Ivy (Except I have to order through DoorDash since I'm outside their delivery zone).
author: Matt L.

description: Apps are to die for along with the curry and noodle plates this is a definite must have for Thai food
author: Maddox R.

description: Favorite Thai in SF. I order from here all the time!! Pumpkin and red curry and tom yum soup are staples. They don't over salt or load in extra sugar to their curries like most Thai places. The pad Thai is a bit sweet though, so go with pad see ew, unless you have a sweet tooth.
author: Christina N.

description: Had the fried rice, pad thai, curry, and coconut soup. All tasted pretty good. Pretty good service and super fast too. We got take out and it was ready in less than 10 minutes.
author: Vera K.

description:
This place is extremely disappointing. Not recommended unless you want your order to be consistently wrong and the service to be completely unhelpful.

I've given this place a few tries and they just can't seem to get it right. The last time was the final straw. I ordered a vegetable/tofu dish, specifying when I placed the order that it be purely vegetarian. I guess that is a concept that they don't understand because after making a trip there to pick up the order, and getting it all the way home, I discovered there were pieces of CHICKEN ALL THROUGHOUT the dish.

When I called to inform them, they wanted me to BRING THE DISH BACK to prove it.

So, not only did I pay money for something I could not eat, their way of remedying the situation was for me to go back there when I just wanted to be in my home eating my dinner.

Um, no.
author: Andi G.

description: I ordered the chicken pad thai and my mother ordered the shrimp pad thai. My mom only got two pieces of shrimp. The noodles hand no flavor and or sauce to them at all. Very bland like eating noodles with no sauce at al. Not to mention the trouble we had just trying to use the code to get a free thai iced tea. Won't be coming back.
author: Oriana S.

description: I wish i could give less than one star. I love Thai food but this place has so many times disappointed me. Their kee maow noodle always very dry! I also tried their other fried noodles but compared to what i had in other Thai restuarants, it always tests as if its missing a lot of ingredients. The only reason i go to this place is because its close to where i live. Today i have decided is my last day.
author: Rahel M.

description:
The larb and papaya salad are both spicy, tasty, and fresh.  The curries never disappoint either.

I've never had to wait here.

The prices are reasonable.
author: David J.

description:
Have only ever picked up here. Make sure you're in the right lane on Pine to pull over for pick-up.  It looks really nice/renovated on the inside and somewhere where i would feel comfortable bringing out-of-towners.

Got the vegetarian thai green curry last night with brown rice. i enjoyed the spicy-ness of it, may be too spicy for non-spicy eaters. 

had leftovers for lunch today and leaves a great flavor in the mouth.
author: Angelica M.

description:
Just your average, run-of-the-mill Thai joint on Divis. Went in on a Sunday evening with my lady and had a good dinner for just a little bit more than I expected. Service was slow, but the servings were big. 

Other diners were mostly from the surrounding college (or so it seemed), so even though it wasn't a full house, it got kind of loud a few times. 

There's nothing wrong here, but nothing to see either.
author: Allison S.

description: Wish you could give half-stars. Ordered delivery, so can't comment on ambiance or service. Food arrived fairly quick. Larb was decent. Drunken noodles were horrendous: too much garlic, almost no veggies, meat way overdone (chewy), and outrageously spicy. Don't know if it was a bad day or not, but I'm afraid to try again.
author: Annat K.

description:
Came here on a friday night, was seated right away and promptly served- it's a good place to come if you are short on time. 

The pumkin curry is wonderful, and my boyfriend liked the jungle lamb. Neither of us were overly impressed with the tom yon - it was a little too sweet and not enough vegetables. Thai iced tea was great. 

The restaurant is a cute little place too, nicely decorated and comfortable. Not too loud- good for conversation.
author: Christy D.

description:
In the way that Thai Food goes, this place is perfectly average - and that's okay!

The flavors of most of their main entrees here are mostly unoffensive - there's nothing rich about them, but they're not exactly bland either. I've had the Pad Thai, Pineapple Fried Rice, and one of their curries. The spices (flavor wise, not heat wise) don't really stand out, but they're willing to pile on chili if you ask!

Overall, it's pretty affordable and never really that busy. They are generally pretty fast here, which is nice. Would recommend if you live nearby and need to dive in for a quick bite.
author: Skippy T.

description: We stopped in for a quick bite and got our food in just a few minutes! Pad Thai and spicy green coconut milk curry. Both dishes were well prepared; the restaurant's decor is "ok" and overall, the experience was just right for good Thai food in a hurry.
author: John H.

description:
I'm not a big fan of spiciness, heat, hot stuff, etc.  I mean a little bite is OK but my limit is nacho jalapeños.  Sorry but I'm a light-weight on this flavor.
But if you are, you'll really like My Ivy.  I've tried a few dishes and the overwhelming memory of each is how spicy it was.  I have to ask for them to tone it down for me but it still makes me reach for my water.  
The food is good though.  Very flavorful, good sized plates.  All the Thai favorites are here along with the famous Thai Iced Tea.  My personal go to is the steak salad (Larb).  I love the combo of lemony, cilantro, mint leaves with everything else.
The have a nice dessert menu too.  The mango and sticky rice is my favorite.
If you like your Thai food spicy, be sure to try My Ivy.  
Parking is tough on nearby streets
author: Pablo R.

description: Best Thai in SF! This place has it all, beautiful decor, hearty portions, and great prices! Their food is delicious and a dinner for two with appetizers, entrees, dessert and drinks can cost under $50.
author: Sara B.

description:
My most favorite place to eat for lunch on a workday....I love everything on their menu! 
The food is always fresh ... I never had a bad experience at My Ivy....but my most favorite dish is their crab fried rice, there are actual crab legs in it and lots of real crab meat...and their Thai Iced Tea:)
author: Apple S.

description: My husband and I ordered the calamari appetizer, drunken noodles with tofu, and pumpkin curry with chicken and it was all very good! We had enough for leftovers and will enjoy them tomorrow! We got there right when it opened so it was a bit dead but the food was delicious on a cold fall night. My only constructive criticism is I would recommend they purchase a subscription for music rather than streaming Pandora. We heard ads throughout the evening and it detracted a bit from the ambiance. Other than that, it was great!
author: Megan R.

description: This is my favorite Thai Place. I've never eaten in because there delivery is just too damn good. The food is delicious, the price is right, the options are plentiful and the delivery is fast and accurate. Highly reco.
author: Penguin P.

description: Very yummy and fresh.  I had the pad thai without onions with chicken and tofu.  It was great.  My husband had drunken noodle with tofu, which was also very good he said.  Great service and very quick.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
Disappointed. I ordered from seamless.com for delivery.

This place had 4 stars on yelp so I was excited, but i found the food sub-par to say the least. I ordered spicy eggplant w/ tofu and papaya salad. both had more iceberg lettuce filling than eggplants, tofu, or papaya. 

i wont be going here again.
author: ellen m.

description: If you want good authentic thai food, then this is not the place to go for. Their food is okay but not good. Their portions are quite small as well, so one dish of noodles may not fill you up. I would only come here if I am desperately craving for Thai food and this is the only place.
author: Lucy C.

description:
My Ivy Thai is located a block away from a BFF's apartment so they eat here all the time. 

They have a great assortment of dishes and I really, really loved their spicy catfish (can ya tell I'm  catfish fan??). It was actually spicy haha. So, that's awesome and kind of rare for a more upscale Thai place. The catfish had just the right balance of crispiness and softness and was served in a red curry / red chili sauce. And it was $10!! This was an amazing price considering the heaping helping of fish they gave.

Their red curry, green curry, and veggie eggrolls were also quite good!
author: Eileen E.

description: The Pineapple & Lychee Prawns is delicious. I've also enjoyed the Chicken Satay, the Caramelized Lychee Duck, and the Mango Salad.
author: Luke F.

description:
My new boyfriend's name is Tom. Tom Kha.

Except he totally sucks here. I hate when my man disappoints me.
author: Joe T.

description:
This review is solely for the fresh spring roll, which I order every time I go there for lunch (and for the peanut sauce that it is served with).  It's a meal for one or an appetizer for up to 4 depending on how hungry you are. 

I'm in love with this beautiful, large, "Thai salad wrap".  Don't remember if I've eaten anything else there.
author: HR P.

description: This place is sooooo good. The coconut rice is to die for and lemongrass chicken is amazing as well. I also got some sort of prawn appetizer with toasted almonds that was very tasty and it even came with its own side salad. Yum!! Very,very impressed and will definitely come again.
author: Pasha S.

description:
Friendly. Newly renovated. 
Pad thai and thai Iced tea are our favorites. Low to moderate prices. 

This is a nice, neighborhood restaurant near California and Divisadero.
author: Richard D.

description: We ate here today.. lunchtime. 12:15pm... waiter rushed to seat us, we asked if we could sit at a different place and was told no, place wasn't even full... waited to get served, then waiter rushing to take our order wth???.. after, my friends food wasn't even finished and she wanted it to go but waiter just piled up our plates without asking and her plate ended up at the bottom of our plate.. wth?... my friends food was ehhh ok.. salmon was good... if the service was better I would come back...!!
author: Kelly B.

description: My favorite restaurant in this area. Friendly service. Totally recommend the beef noodle soup
author: Erika Y.

description: Seems like there is a thai tradeoff in the city... environment vs food. My Ivy wins on ambiance, comfort, and cleanliness. If you're just talking about food quality there are better places (cough, cough...Jitlada...cough). But as a friendly neighborhood thai spot it works and I'll keep coming back.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
This thai place is literally across the street from my boyfriends and I love Thai food. We came here after game 6 of the GIants game before they made it to the World Series! I got the Tom Yum Noodle Soup which was good. It was basically the normal Tom Yum plus noodles. I like my Thai pretty spicy, and I thought id be a little more, which was what I was wanting.

My bf got the druken noodles, I tasted it, and it was good. He enjoyed it as he ate up most of the plate.

Will be back!
author: Jess O.
