description: I have always been pleased by this restaurant and never reviewed it, but today I received such rude and obnoxious lack of customer service that I can to come in and warn people to not order take out from this place.  If you do, do not expect your order to be accurate or the staff to be polite when acknowledging their mistake or gracious when correcting it!
author: Katrina N.

description:
It was good enough and the service was great. However, I would rate this place as average and nothing really special. Which means I'd totally come back on any normal lunch or dinner but not somewhere I'd take people to try and impress them.

I think the Pad See Ew was great and their papaya salad was good. I do love how much natural light is in this restaurant and not stuffy like a lot of moderately-priced Thai places.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Pros:
This is one of the best thai restaurants in the northern areas of the city, and pretty under-appreciated. The Mango salad and Lemongrass chicken are excellent choices, and you really can't go wrong here, and rarely need a reservation.

Cons:
Parking can be tough on Divis.

Fun:
Walking down Divisadero after dinner you can see all sorts of interesting shops and bars..
author: Mike G.

description:
I've been here a couple of times and can safely say that I like this place.  It's not anything that will blow you away or spectacular by any means, but it is safe.  The prices are fair, there is a lot of variety, they deliver and overall the food is tasty.  For convenience and overall quality I rate this 3/5 stars because I feel like it's hard to mess up thai food.  There are many options in San Francisco and many other places I would recommend other than My Ivy, but each time I've ordered from here I haven't been disappointed.  

The next time you are near Divisadero and California and craving thai food I recommend that you try out My Ivy.
author: Natan O.

description:
Free online ordering, free delivery, fast and friendly service, cheap cheap cheap!

I have been a die-hard osha fan for a couple years, but I was really far away, craving some thai, and My Ivy Thai was calling my name.  I am so happy I responded... I had the pumpkin curry, which was awesome.  It's also only $10.  tip: a bowl of soup serves 2 - 4 people.
author: Torrey R.

description:
I agree with the 4 star rating.  My Ivy isn't like most Thai restaurants, it is modern inside and they serve the soups in cool shaped bowls! They have a lunch menu and most items are around the $8 range, which is very reasonable. 

My hubby ordered his peppercorn tofu and veggies dish spicy, and it was SPICY, Thai style! He probably got it super spicy because he ordered it in Thai, but despite being spicy, it was very delicious. I had the tom yum gai noodle soup, which was flavorful. The chicken was a little dry to me, but I enjoyed the noodles.
author: Natalie S.

description:
100+ reviews and 4 stars overall?  Hm.

I ordered delivery from here a couple of months ago.  It was delivered to my house in 10 minutes.  10 minutes!  Such potential.  And then I ate the food.  Blech.  Can't remember everything we ordered but one of the items was Ivy Best Friends.  The chicken was nasty and the whole thing was cold and rubbery.  It must have been sitting on the counter for a while.

With all of these good reviews maybe I should try it again.
author: Guesty G.

description: I went here yesterday by myself and had the Tom Kha soup and chicken stay skewers. They were both really bad. The soup was thick, milky and sour and the satay tasted like peanut butter. They were both very one dimensional and I couldn't finish the meal. I thought I might take the rice home for later but it wasn't good either because it tasted like paper. Additionally I did not digest this well the following day. I would only give one star but the wait staff was nice.
author: Shelly H.

description:
The food is really good ! We got food delivered to us for the first time and the delivery came quicker than was predicted which was really nice. 

I got drunken noodles with chicken and i like a little spice so they were very good however, my friend got the same and she is extremely sensitive to spicy foods and it was too spicy for her. It all depends on your taste though. The flavoring was very good and you could definitely taste the garlic in the recipe !!

As for price I thought it was reasonable, 9.00 for a good size portion of noodles seemed very fair to me :) overall I suggest trying it !!
author: Hannah B.

description: I went there  for lunch with a group of co-workers.  We had a group of 10 and called ahead to reserve a table.  When we got there, the table was ready for us and the service was super fast.  Everyone enjoyed their drinks and food, definitely a good place for tasty lunch and nice ambiance... will definitely come back.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I've eaten here a few times since the name was changed. The menu is changed too and most likely the chef because the food is way better then the thai place that used to be in this location. 

I've had a few of the rice and noodle dishes. All were yummy! I'll be back.
author: Kris B.

description:
Wandered here one nice sunny day when I didn't know what to eat for lunch and I'm glad I wandered in here. Lunch prices are very reasonable for dishes and they have lunch specials that come with soup too. 

My favorite here is the Pad Kee Mow. Super spicy but sooo goood! One of the better ones I've had. 

Pad Siew- not really a fan of this. Kind of plain tasting

Papayra salad with Shrimp- this was huge and good too. The grill shrimp just tasted a little too grilled for me

Pineapple fried rice- I loved the curry taste. But I could do without the cashews and raisins in it

If you are in the area and craving Thai food I would recommend.
author: Annie L.

description:
It can be hard moving to a new neighborhood. You want to find your new favorite go to places. There are quite a few thai restaurants near our new place, but My Ivy is the best. We are so excited to have found you, My Ivy! 

The first time we went, I ordered the spicy catfish in red coconut curry sauce. The dish was super tasty with lots of vegetables. My husband ordered the caramelized lychee duck. WOAH. I love how they have rice options other than just white. Fun soju cocktails as well. 
Now that My Ivy has won us over, we've ordered take out many times: Tom Kha, Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, Spicy Eggplant, Calamari, Crab Rangoons... ALL delicious.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I really love this place.  We live in the neighborhood and have a young child, so we are frequently in need of good delivery food when we find ourselves at the end of the day, exhausted, with no dinner plans.  And Ivy delivers, usually in 30 minutes or less (despite what they quote us on the phone).

They replaced another Thai restaurant that was at this location, and improved the food and service dramatically. They have really creative specials,  very high quality food, and they really do listen when you ask them for modifications (more spicy / less spicy / not so much pepper / etc).  

I absolutely adore the Ivy Beef, the almond prawn appetizer, the Pad See Ew, and just about everything else on the menu.  The Pra-Ram has more vegetables than just spinach, which was a nice surprise. The mango sticky rice is hit or miss. It's never BAD, but sometimes it has an abundance of coconut milk and sometimes it's lacking. When they do it right, it's the best I've ever had.  

The people who take phone orders and the delivery guys are all super friendly and clearly appreciate our business.  I like that they have our information in the computer, so we just have to give our phone number and they are ready to take our order.

I haven't actually been inside the restaurant, so I can't make any comments about that!  

So overall, if you are looking for super scrumptious Thai food, definitely make a point of calling or stopping by My Ivy.
author: Sherri H.

description:
Tried this new Thai spot in the 'hood. Not close at all to Lers Ros quality and flavors but some dishes might do in a pinch.

The chicken larb had pretty good flavors, but it's served with iceberg lettuce instead of the typical cabbage.

Sweet basil with pork, requested Thai spicy, was unbalanced. It needed more fish sauce and the pork was tough. I asked for Thai chilies but they gave me chili sauce instead, equivalent to Sriracha, which would ruin the flavors of the dish.

The Tom Yum was fine, could have been spicier, but the prawns weren't deveined properly.

Lers Ros delivery sounds more appealing after writing this.
author: Derrick V.

description: I can't believe this place doesn't show up as 4 stars.  I would urge anyone who rated it less than 4 stars to give them a second chance, because their less than 4-star experience was probably a fluke.  I have come here several times for take out and a few times to dine in.  I absolutely love the catfish; it's so delicious, I can never stop myself from scarfing down the entire dish, even when I'm full.  I also love their eggplant, pineapple fried rice, and prawns.  Their service is excellent; friendly and SUPER fast (whether it's dining in, delivery, or pick up). The restaurant also is very clean.  They have never messed up my order.  I would give them 4 1/2 stars if I could.
author: JJ M.

description: ya'll.... it was great. We ordered online with the eat24 app. Speedy delivery. Great taste.
author: Jamie G.

description:
Went here on a Saturday for dinner with a group. We had planned on having Mexican but were told they couldn't accomadate our party of 8 so we stumbled into My Ivy and they took us in from the rain. I thought that the food was fantasitc. We each ordered an entree and we had a bunch of appetizers for the table. We passed around our dishes so that we could each try everything and I was very impressed. So often with Thai, you can taste the oil that they sautee the food in but not here- it was fresh and light tasting. 

The best part is, even with wine, beer, probably 6 appetizers and 8 entrees, the bill split 3 ways was only $65 with tip included. A very nice, upscale dinner for under $100?- I'm sold!
author: Carly T.

description:
I have tried a few Thai restaurants in the city and My Ivy is by far my favorite! Each time I have been, the atmosphere is fun, the service is excellent and friendly, the food is delicious, and it is totally budget-friendly. You can never go wrong with the Red Curry Beef. The cocktails are yummy and exciting. I would definitely recommend giving My Ivy a try if you're in the mood for some Thai food!

Also, make sure you check out the sink in the bathroom. It's super-cool!
author: Angie G.

description:
Yet another new thai restaurant near work means one more good lunch option.  We finally checked My Ivy out yesterday and were really impressed.  

We liked the clean and minimalist decor, and the presentation of the dishes was very nice (the pictures really are accurate).  They constantly refilled my water, and the food came out rather quickly, so we were impressed.  

Three of us shared the crab rangoon and chicken satay appetizers.  Both were very good, very fresh, very hot.  We then shared the pumpkin curry with chicken and the drunken noodles (pad kee mao) with beef.  Both servings were very generous, and we were thoroughly stuffed.  I appreciated that the beef and chicken were large slices, rather than ground bits, and the veggies were really good on both.  

Reasonably priced for the nice food and the serving sizes, so I'm sure My Ivy will be seeing more of us in the future.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
When I have no complaints about my take-out order (beef pad thai, spring rolls, Ivy Best Friends), it's appropriate to write a haiku:

Ordered three items
Only ate half of these things
Tasty and a deal!
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Update: This place has gone slightly downhill since it opened. Pretty bummed about it!

Since the moment My Ivy moved in, I've been hooked! Their pumpkin curry is full of flavor, and the drunken fried rice has everything you'd ever want in a rice! I always order it for delivery, and it always comes in 30 min or less and the driver is always very polite! Definitely recommend!
author: Lizzie L.

description: Stopped in here for dinner a little while ago and had a very good pad see ew. Funny something that tastes so good would have the word "ew" in it. But this is also a language where "moo" means pork. :-)
author: Dan B.

description: This place is always busy, they have very good lunch menu very reasonably priced. Waiters are nice and quick.
author: Y R.

description:
One word: yummy.

I appreciate that the food was fresh and clean and didn't leave me feeling heavy / oily. I've been twice in one week I loved it so much! I need to eat - in next time -- I've only tried the take out.

I'm a fan of spicy food, so I loved the spicy green beans with chicken and thai peppercorn with chicken. I prefer their chicken to their tofu.

Good spot - glad they are in the neighborhood!
author: Sarah T.

description: Frustrating because I asked for rice and it wasn't delivered with my meal, spent 30 minutes cooking my own rice to go with their curry. Not what you want to do when you order take out.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I got a delivery and wasnt expecting much as most delivery food is...  well..  average and then came My Ivy to tinkle my taste buds.

I can't wait to go in one of these days and eat at the restaurant!
author: Sumit G.

description:
Food:
I ordered the drunken noodle and the duck curry.  The drunken noodle was way too spicy for me (and I am not a wimp when it comes to spicy food).  I really enjoyed the duck curry; it was flavorful and delicious. 

Delivery:
I called My Ivy to get free delivery.  It was a Sunday evening.  They promised that the food would be at my place in 40 minutes.  20 minutes later, they were at my door.  I was very pleased.  

Overall, good experience.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
I may be a little bias, only because this place is two blocks away from may apartment, but I'll have to say that the food is pretty damn good!

I've been here for a total of three times and each time I went, 4 starts right off the back.  This restaurant is in a good location for all you Lower Pac Heighters and the prices are very reasonable.  Service is excellent and the food does not take long to come out.  

Generally, I'll order the green papaya salad, pad see eww with pork or chicken, and a side of the sweet and sour chicken.  The last time I went, we ordered the spicy catfish.  I don't really like cooked fish in general, but the spicy catfish was oh so delicious.  

You can also order takeout and delivery, but I have yet to try that.  Overall, an excellent place to get some thai loving!
author: Shad B.

description:
All I know is I kept saying " wow this is so good" after every bite. That was basically the theme song to my meal. We ordered the following: 

Chicken Satay
Spicy Catfish
Pineapple and Lychee Prawns
Ivy Best Friends

Recommendation - Eat the spicy catfish with a little sticky rice from the Ivy Best Friends. This is heaven. 

Extra plus- legit to go containers, no spill or mess. Food was piping hot! 

Wonderful! Yummmm!
author: Alexa V.

description:
This place just opened on Friday night last week, replacing the often dissapointing, and empty, Khoon Chang Thai.  

Last night Morgan G. and I ate here and were stoked, finally good Thai on Divis.  Finally.  

We started with spring rolls with a side of peanut sauce.  I like to consider myself the world's foremost expert on spring rolls (as if you didn't already know) and these are some of the better ones I've ever had.  

We followed with Green Papaya salad, and it too was extremely good.  

Finally, we had some Pumpkin Chicken Curry with conconut rice.  All of it was excellent, really some of the best I've had in SF.  

Finally, as if you didn't need another reason to check this place out, they managed all this great food and delivery on only their 4th day open (no growing pains) and already are serving wine, beer, and soju drinks.

Finally (for reals this time) the place is a little family-owned joint and they're bringing good Thai to Divis, GO SUPPORT THEM!
author: Carl B.

description:
I had dinner with friends the other night at My Ivy and i was impress how they urbanize the place from typical Thai restaurant to cozy and nicely design place. 

Not only the decor that i like but also the food! Of course it's what i came here for. The food here is awesome. Me and my friend ordered a bunch of dishes like Almond prawns, Caramelized Lychee duck, papaya salad and Golden calamari. I'd say my fav dish is the almond prawns, i think the portion was just right and its comes on the bed of crispy noodle which i really like. This dish is a must! 

Well, if you read this long, i think you must interested in this place so why don't you just go try it yourself.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Hurrah for pumpkin curry! 

Adorable little thai place that will seat you immediately and serve you delicious thai food.  Easily my favorite thai place in the city!
author: Hillary W.

description:
Fantastic mid-range, Thai spot.  It's fairly new and we stopped in on a whim on a rainy day for dinner.  Started with the crispy veggie spring rolls then the chicken Pad Thai and spicy string beans with vegetables and tofu.  Everything was delicious and brought out in a timely manner.  The Pad Thai had a great flavor and you could choose the spiciness of the string beans.  Both dishes had enough portions for decent sized left overs.  My only qualm was that the string beans didn't come with a side of rice.  The prices were very reasonable.

We didn't have to wait at all and it looks like this place does quick take-out and delivery business.  However, after all these reviews, that might change!
author: AJ L.

description:
Excellent Food!
 Great service!
Pineapple Fried Rice, Pad Thai, and the yellow curry were AMAZING.
author: Diana R.

description:
The lychee duck was perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious.  The cocktail I had was probably one of the best I've had, although I cannot remember what it's called for the life of me.  My friend's lychee martini was far too sweet, but not the worst I've ever had.  

My Ivy is perfectly decorated, but the music was absolutely painful.  I've been to many restaurants that play remade version of 90's hits, which are always awful, but usually not so loud.  Unfortunately, it really took away from the meal and probably explains why so many people were coming in to pick up an order instead of sitting for their meal.
author: Colleen M.

description: Ok, so I ate here today and I enjoyed everything on my table. Had some Fresh Spring Rolls, Golden Calamari and a unique refreshing...Pineapple-Lychee Prawns. DAMN!! Pineapple-Lychee Prawns. Oh, and coconut rice. I Like this place.
author: Glyde W.

description:
Nasty... I don't know how this place has such a high rating. 

EDIT: Actually... now I think I know how this place has such high ratings... totally an artificially inflated rating. If you look at many of the reviews they are from people with 1-3 reviews and generic names. 90% of the pictures are professional looking photos added by people who don't even have any reviews... 4 stars is a scam, don't fall for it.

Ordered delivery.

Got vegetable Yellow Curry instead of chicken like I ordered and it didn't come with rice.

The Angel Wings were not crispy and were incredibly fatty and soggy. Also had an odd flavor - I could not eat them.

Pad Thai had an odd sour smell and tasted worse. I bit into a piece of the egg in it and almost gagged - stopped eating it right then.

Also, not cheap - wasted $30 and now I need to go find dinner.
author: Troy K.

description: Ive been coming here for years during my lunch break and the last few times service has been lacking since they've gotten two new female servers. I have to hunt someone down to take my order and to bring the bill. I was served my soup that was not hot, the same time they brought my food. They make me want to stop coming but therr are only a few choices in the neighborhood to eat. The guy server always guves good service though.
author: chari b.

description:
I'm Thai and this place rocks! 

Basil fried rice is my favorite! Highly recommended. 

Very friendly wait staff! 

Great interior design!

A unique selling point about this restaurant is one particular type of sticky rice that you will never be able to get elsewhere! Ask the wait staff and they will tell you exactly what it is!
author: Freedom F.

description:
Full disclosure..I've been to Thailand a few times...eating at street vendors, home cookoing and high end hotels in Bangkok. I've paid way too much for eats 1/2 as good as this.

I can only offer 4 stars, because I did a take out order, so I really cant comment on the sit-down part of the service, but while waiting, folks seem genuine and attentive. The recent remodel adds a touch of class...think a bit below Osha, but way above the previous establishments design. 

The Tom Young Goong (hot sweet and sour shrimp) was really well balanced..just the right amount kaffir lime leaves in there..several places seem really to overdo that element. I can see this will be a great item on those summer (a.k.a "winter" nights). Also can recommend the Pad Thai (chicken in this case). Standard fare I know, but I have had many blown attempts at this. I think the difference is they got the soaked noodles just right. Not bad for newly opened. In fact, very good.  

I'll be returning many times to sample the rest of the menu, now I've got great Thai down the street.
author: David C.

description:
My Ivy is by far our favorite Thai place in the city and we have enjoyed becoming regulars here since soon after they opened.  It is 1/2 block from our house and a "go-to" place for us when we have guests in from out of town and need a quick place to have a good dinner.  

Highlights:

--Starters:
Mango or Papaya Salad: order extra spicy and it starts the meal off right.
Spring rolls: top notch and not greasy

Mains:
Spicy catfish
Red Curry with Chicken, extra spicy

We have a 6 month old child and they have always been amazing in accommodating her as well.  In short, this is the quintessential neighborhood restaurant for us and we recommend it highly
author: Andy M.

description: Giving it 2 stars, its too bad because the food in this place has got potential. When we didn't have a kid we frequented this place. It's near a ton of other casual quick eats on Divisadero but the service and attitude we got from the people working here recently totally sucks. We ordered the pumpkin tofu curry and a bunch of other dishes for delivery. The menu indicated we can order non-spicy and so we ordered this dish for our 3 year old. When the food arrived, it wasn't just spicy it was flaming crazy spicy, so clearly we can't feed that to our toddler. I called the restaurant and they said "we can't make exceptions the curry is pre made (Um, even though you can order it that way ). Just brush off the spice and next time YOU HAVE to order the other kind of curry". Like FORREALS? You talk to your customers like that? "Just brush it off" it's in the freaking sauce, yo. A W E S O M E. Ah, how about no. Big fat no. Luckily, we placed our order through eat24, called them and they refunded us since we had to toss that firey  dish in the trash. Bye Felicia!
author: michelle z.

description:
I am an original Thai, and grew up in Thai restaurants business. Of course I am very picky about Thai food. Mostly I cook Thai food at home but after foot surgery I am not be able to cook for myself and friends. One time, My fiance had to pick up my stuff@ Kaiser so I asked him if he could get me some papaya salad at any Thai restaurants. My ivy seems to be the best choice.

So he ordered some papaya salad and pad see ew chicken to go for me. After I ate papaya salad, I woud say It was nice balance between sweet and sour and a little kick off thai chili. I love grilled shrimp on my salad as well. But for the Pad see ew chicken, It wasn't right for my taste yet. The noodles needs to cook a bit longer, and more sauce on it.
author: Sasitorn O.

description:
I highly recommend MyIvy restaurant!  I live nearby, so I frequent this place as a very reliable source for good Thai food.  My go-to is the Pineapple Fried Rice, and lately I've been enamored with the Pumpkin Curry -- these are usually to-go for lunch, but the indoor seating is also nice.  Plus, this sounds kind of weird, but the sink in their bathroom is really cool.  The servers there are super friendly and always greet me with a smile.

They've also donated for my AIDS/LifeCycle ride, so I personally can vouch that these are good people.  It's reasonably priced, and the food is fantastic.  MyIvy, you rock!
author: Steven L.

description: Veggie spring rolls were mediocre, nothing special. Beef & basil had way too much garlic and the beef was very tough unfortunately. I was the first customer of the day so perhaps that was the issue. Just not sure about this place at all.
author: Kevin K.

description:
It's tough deciding to rate this a 3* or a 4* establishment. This is one of the few places open on a Sunday evening within walking distance of UCSF Mt Zion. I called ahead for takeout, and ordered a curry dish along with a lemongrass chicken dish. Pickup happened without issues, except that when I opened everything up, I realized we had no utensils. Arrrgh! Okay, maybe a one time slight but I'm not deducing stars for that.

Ultimately, I think it's a 3* because I thought the food was just mediocre. I've had better thai food elsewhere.
author: Eric C.

description: truly a perfect green curry served with a smile. thank you, my ivy!!! I will try the lychee martini next time xoxo
author: Tyler W.

description: The Tom kha ga wasn't what I expected in Thai flavor but I didn't order any of the star menu items people rave about. Seating is a little crowded, I had to wait outside to take my food to go. You're lucky if you find parking. The ambiance is nice with an intimate feel and trees decorated with lights. I recommend OSHA Thai their pumpkin curry is awesome as well. However if staying in the Fillmore/Steiner area I'm walking distance and curious to go back to try their crispy calamari.
author: Hollylujah W.

description:
spring rolls were good. great presentation but average taste. 

Tom yum soup: didn't like it bc it was on too much on the sweet side. it had cabbage, broccoli, and carrots in it... not authentic.
author: Tea Lyves ..

description:
Delivery was quick but the quality of food mediocre. 

The papaya salad was a bit soggy and mostly lettuce, not enough papaya.

Drunken Noodle (Pad Kee Maow) had one piece of broccoli, not bamboo shoots and was sparse on any ingredients other than just the noodles.
author: F S.

description:
Decided to come here for the boyfriend's birthday back in early May.  

We ordered the
-Dumpling Curry: $7 Straight up tasted like Ling Ling Potstickers. It was luke warm when it arrived to our table.  Don't get me wrong  I love ling ling potstickers.  But I'm not going pay $7 for 6 luke warm ones when I can get a whole bag from Costco.
-Almond Prawns: $7 More like almond shrimp because it was so small.  When I see prawns, I expected big, huge prawns!  These were dinky little things, and you only get 5 pieces in an order.  Texture and flavor wasn't bad, but again not a lot for $7.
-Pad See Ew: $8 Got this with chicken.  So little noodles.  I love pad see ew with LOTS OF NOODLES!  Chicken was very dry.  I didn't even eat any of it.
-Druken Linguine: $8? (I think that is the price)  This dish was a little spicy for me.  Wasn't anything special.  Just tasted like a stirfry noodle.
-Crab Fried Rice: $11 This dish had a lot of crab it in, and the flavor was okay.  The thing that got me was the rice was so mushy! Clumps of rice all mushed together.  Ew!  The texture was just horrible.
-Caramelized Lychee Duck: $13 ALL FAT AND OILY AS HELL! Ehhh gross.  I took one bite and felt pimples growing on my face already.  I know duck can be fatty already, but this one was EXTRA FATTY.

Tried this place, didn't like it, will not be coming back.
author: Donna F.

description:
It's never a good sign when bathroom sinks and a service faux pas are more memorable than the food.

Things were headed towards a soft three stars after a meal of good if not great thai food. Spring rolls came sitting in peanut sauce (wished it was served on the side like most everywhere else), seafood soup was missing a lot of shrimp (or was just not very generous on portions), grilled chicken (lemongrass perhaps? I wasn't the one ordering) was solid as was the tofu with veggies. The dish I was most looking forward to, pinapple and prawns in a red curry, was good but much like the soup, light on the goods.

Favorite part was the bathroom sink. Blue color with a unique design that had the water flowing from the faucet onto a plate and into your hands. More interesting than the food. Overall design of the space was good too. Loved the exposed bricks, just enough to feel modern, but not too much that it felt out of place for the neighborhood.

Probably would have gone three stars if it weren't for the finale. We were a large group celebrating a birthday, and the bill was large with tip included. Everyone had paid their share and we were about to leave before we were stopped to let us know they forgot to add a dish. Really? Hundreds of dollars later? There was no time to double check, we paid and left. Those are mistakes you catch before giving us the bill.

Skip. Unless you need to use the bathroom.
author: Jason B.

description: The food is good here, but the customer service is Terrible. My co workers and I ate here one day, and I ordered a dish that had crushed peanuts on top when my dish was brought  out. It was my mistake, the menu did say there were peanuts in the dish, but we were rushing and I read it really fast when I ordered it and missed that memo. I am not allergic to peanuts, but they don't sit well in my stomach and I knew I was not going to like it. When the waitress brought my food out I politely asked her if it was possible to remake the dish with out the peanuts on top. She responded with a "no" and proceeded to tell me that it was my fault, I made the mistake, I should have read the menu and  if they made me another dish, I would have to pay for an additonal dish, so I would be charged twice for one plate, because of course, they were going to take the first one back. I couldn't belive what she had said, she was being very argumentatvie and rude. I apologized and stated that I was not aware that the dish was topped with peanuts, being that I had this particular dish many times from other Thai resturants and never had it been topped with crushed peanuts, so again my mistake for breifly skimming the menu and ordering, but if I ask for the dish to be remade, as your paying customer, I don't ever want my server yelling at me, blaming me and saying it was my mistake so I would have to be charged for two if the dish was remade, just simply, remake the dish.
author: Kiesh M.

description:
I've been back for many, many lunches. My comment on service wasn't really accurate. It is quick and efficient, but the last several visits the waiting staff was very attentive and friendly. This is my go to spot for lunch on Divis. Solid Thai food, large servings for a low price, and good service. Well done. 
Some specifics:
Get there early for lunch and get free soup with your entre. I've sometimes rolled in around 2pm and they don't serve it. 
The lunch specials are a great deal at $8, but it's really a lot of food... as in curry, rice, and BBQ chicken all on one big plate. If you're looking for an even better deal, try the noodle or rice dishes which are around $6.50 and are very filling. 
I like the soups, particularly the Tom Kha. $4 for a decent service size, or $8 for a huge container of it.
If they offered less expensive starters, I would definitely get the Tom Kha and a starter for lunch.
author: Adam F.

description: This is my favorite local little spot. Service might take a while, but you can have a specialty drink while you wait or a Thai beer. Love the mango or green papaya salad. They are the perfect size to share as a app with the spring rolls it is a meal. The spring rolls are the best ever and a good serving size. Soups and everything are right on.
author: Katie S.

description: Although the name does not sound tasty the food is amazing. The Spring Rolls were super fresh and they way they were presented in a bed of sauce was perfect. The Lychee Prawn Curry Amazing a perfect balance of salt and sweet. The drunken noodles were great as well.  I cannot figure out why this place is so empty on a Saturday night. The staff was very friendly and service was impeccable. I would encourage anyone to visit for a very unique  "original" Thai experience.
author: Bill M.

description:
I order take out from this place pretty often.  A lot of it has to do with their reasonable minimum order and free delivery, but that's not to say they don't make great food too.  I love the pad kee mao, spicy with chicken.  Their pad thai is also pretty tasty.  I haven't had their curries so I can't comment on those.  

In the area and wanting thai?  My Ivy will hit the spot.
author: Bobby L.

description:
I enjoyed the pork chop i had and the salmon dish was yum. i know ive had better thai food from other places in sf, this one tho has an ease of convenience,since its near walking distance from work. 

Drinks- lychee martini was a bit sweeet, but good amount to get you warm inside. 

Waitresses here are VERY Sweet and VERY attentive. A+ for service
author: Cali L.

description: Got takeout here since I live a block away. Customer service wasn't its best but I guess because I didn't eat there. Wasn't greeted when I walked in until I reached the cashier, the lady stood and looked at me until I said something first. Said I came for a pickup and she brought me my food and with its bill and walked away. Rude -__- but I liked their Tom Yum soup. The pad Thai was okay, I've had better. The chicken was really bland, the noodles were super sticky so it was hard to eat a little at a time. Don't think I will be coming here often but it's alright here.
author: Amanda C.

description: OK for lunch. I had a clay-pot which came quickly (the menu says it can take a while). It was good - a mixture of chicken, shrimp, sausage and snow peas atop rice.   I liked it, but it was lightly seasoned, but you get a dish of the sweet-chile sauce.  You get a soup as well to accompany this lunch.
author: Dan C.

description: Very good. Ordered delivery and it was all great: chicken satay, pumpkin curry and the amazing beef noodle soup. Reasonable prices and quick delivery.
author: Danielle C.

description: I am a big fan of Thai food. My Ivy, it is the place for Thai cuisine. My family loves to eat  Thai food. Our favorite dishes at My Ivy are the Ivy beef and the spicy cat fish. My kids love the fish! The place is clean and the service is great. We have no complaints. Often times, we order to take out because the restaurant is close to our place. We get the same kind of fast, clean, neat, and friendly service level as we would do the eat-in. Check it out! You'll love their food and service.
author: Bao D.

description:
We had take out from My Ivy this evening. It's our first time eating there since the remodel and menu updates. It didn't disappoint, though would likely have been better to dine-in.

We had the Calamari, which would have been better if fresh out of the fryer. As it was, the flavor was good even if the texture had "wilted" a bit in transit.

The Pad Se Ew and Sweet Thai Basil Pork were both tasty - the trip to our house appeared to have impacted them less.

Overall, we enjoyed the meal and will definitely eat there again, though maybe as a dine-in experience instead of take-out, given our menu choices!
author: Karen C.

description:
I ordered two servings of coconut rice for one green curry.  It came in one of the smaller boxes and was tagged x2, but i still have curry and no more rice...also didn't get the toothpick I checked the box for when ordering online, which I don't care about, but whats the point in having a check box for it if they don't give you one.
Other than that, it was good food, but not mind blowing, so its A-OK
author: Myler M.

description: This is a delightful spot for quick thai food. Since I live a short distance, I make it a point to call take-out a few times a month. I quite enjoy the vegetarian soup with tofu and some hot sauce as well as a fan of the tofu spring rolls!
author: Megan T.

description: Pleasantly surprised!! Great service and great affordable food!! Would definitely recommend.
author: Katie S.

description: Got takeout from here and was absolutely not impressed. The Tom Yum Soup was pretty much inedible-- bland broth with whole mushrooms and quartered tomatoes. The Pad Thai was nothing original, and it was missing lime and peanuts for topping. The red curry was decent, but nothing above average. This place seems to have pretty good reviews so my bad experience could have been a fluke with getting delivery, but I doubt I'd ever try it again.
author: Will A.

description: 3-3.5.  I've tried many restaurants on Divis, and I finally made my way up to this one.  I came here with my boyfriend on our lunch breaks.  I ordered the yellow curry and my boyfriend got the pad kee mow.  The food came out very quickly (brownie points for that), and the portions were decent.  I liked the curry, and from my sample of my boyfriend's dish, the noodles were pretty good too.  However, the food was nothing really special; when we left, I didn't really feel the need to come back.
author: Can C.

description: My Ivy is a thousand times better than the restaurant it replaced a couple years ago so I'm always secretly grateful for that. I live across the street and enjoy coming down for the occasional dinner here. My friends and I love the $5 cocktails! Whenever they house sit for us they take full advantage. The service is always pleasant and the interior is clean and modern. My favorite dishes are the fresh spring rolls (so tasty!), pumpkin curry, and pineapple fried rice. My friends always order the duck fried rice (which I don't think it on the menu) and they go nuts over it.
author: Katelyn C.

description:
Tasty food, attractively presented. Nice atmosphere. The papaya salad was really good. Portion sizes generous, we took half of the food home. They offer very nice brown rice. 
The kitchen seemed disorganized: our first entree, drunken noodles, came out with chicken instead of the requested tofu. The next dish arrived 15 minutes later, with the exact same mix of chicken and red and green peppers, with a few eggplant slices added to make it an eggplant dish. It seems they use the same prep bowl of veggies to put in all their dishes?
author: Patti H.

description:
This place is our takeout staple in the neighborhood.  It is fast, cheap, and the food is fantastic.  Definitely the best Thai food in the neighborhood.  The people who work there are super nice and friendly.  Love the yellow curry, love the cashew chicken, love the crispy rolls.  One thing that is great about My Ivy is that the dishes seem to be less greasy and oily than any other Thai place, so when we do takeout I don't feel like I'm necessarily eating anything as unhealthy as most other takeout food.

My Ivy is definitely worth a stop for lunch if you work nearby and to add in to your rotation for take-out food or delivery in the area.  You wont be disappointed.
author: Aaron N.

description: My Ivy is my neighborhood spot and never fails to please.  Great food for take out, but the ambiance of the restaurant is enjoyable too, I'm surprised more people don't eat in.
author: Theresa O.

description: Best thai food ever! Get the pad thai with chicken it's amazing. Their lava cake is also excellent. Fast delivery too! It was so good I tried calling their manager over and over and over and over to tell them how good the food was, but I never heard back. I will continue to call until the manger hears my review personally. It was amazing.
author: Andrew G.

description: Fine for a quick Thai place to eat.  I was underwhelmed by the food (I ordered soup and a veggie side dish).  I have eaten better Thai food (comparing same soup) in San Francisco.  The prices were reasonable and the service was okay.
author: Mary L.

description: This review is long overdue since I eat at My Ivy about...once a week. This place is great. A couple of the noodle dishes weren't my absolute favorite but the curries are bomb. The food is good, service is fast, and prices are definitely reasonable. This is my go-to spot for sure.
author: Sara V.

description:
Quick terrible delivery food. Not the combination I was looking for. 
Tom Ka soup: It was pretty much warm coconut milk with 2 prawns and 3 diced mushroom.

Mango Salad: Decent - Fresh Mango 

Crab rice: 2 tiny crab claws with barely anything on them + lots of tasteless greasy rice. 

Price for all of this: $28
author: The Y s.

description:
Water glasses were filled with no question, pumpkin curry is out of the world. Great place to go after a long day of work, the spices woke up our senses.  The spicy green beans with chicken were good too.
Wonderful place to catch up with old friends.
author: Sharon C.

description: We loved this place. We ate and drank like kings for $30. The only down side was that we were one of three groups eating in the dining room on a Saturday at 8pm. We have since figured out that this place mainly subsists on take out and it was a bit odd that it wasn't crowded. However, I would love to put in a plug for eating there! The dining room was lovely and every bit as chic as any other place in the neighborhood. The staff was also amazing. We started with a MASSIVE order of spring rolls that were super fresh and delicious. For dinner we had pad thai, and spicy thai basil. Both had great flavors but could have been a bit more bold. Why four stars? There is no where else in our neighborhood you can get this atmosphere, service, and freshly prepared food. Also all cocktails are $4 or $5 dollars.
author: Kim K.

description: This is THE BEST Tom Kha soup I've ever had!  Yummy!!!
author: Crystal I.

description: They do not deliver to the Marina, although they are 1 mile away.  Please stop including the Marina as a neighborhood your company delivers to.  It is misleading and a total waste of one's time.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Based on the food I had last night, I'd give this place a 2... but based on the experience I had, I raised it to a 4. I ordered delivery, and it wasn't good-- at all. It was really not good. I was super disappointed, so I called the restaurant to let them know that the meal I had was a total miss, and I thought one of the dishes was spoiled or something. The woman who helped me wasn't a manager, but acted more professionally than many managers I've encountered (and worked with). When I called, I was really quite certain I'd not ever try them again, but by the time I got off the phone, I knew I'd give them another try. The food may just not be to my liking, but the service was so great and so impressive that I'll definitely try it again-- more businesses need to act like this one did, and I'm very happy to support that. 

(Side note-- I ordered delivery through Eat24, and that is a service I'll never use again. BOO.)
author: Mrs. J.

description: The people working there seemed nice enough and my waitress recommended a chicken and green curry combo, which looked great when it hit my table.  On closer inspection, I saw that the chicken was pink and raw in multiple places. The beef curry was fine but my experience was tainted overall; I find Salmonella to be a bummer.
author: Baron C.

description:
went in on a Monday, service okay, but the food wasn't spectacular, a little disappointed on presentation, lunch overall okay, needs work on entrees, no pop. 

Otherwise it's "just" another Thai restaurant in the City. Potential to do well in the area it's in.....
author: Edgar M.

description: Came here for lunch multiple times. I always get the mango salad with shrimp extra spicey.  It is awesome! As well as the string beans with ground chicken and brown rice. Gotta ask for ground chicken. Soooo much better and tastier. I got all my coworkers hooked on ground chicken now haha.  Definitely recommend this place for lunch.
author: Abra S.

description: Hands down, good Thai food for cheap. I love their complimentary soup as a starter and I love their BBQ pork and chicken with rice. $8-10 bucks, big portions. Yummy. I'm happy at the end it, hence the five stars. The service is fast too during lunch hour. Good call for those working within walking distance and have about an hour
author: Manu M.

description: We ordered in tonight. There was nothing particularly bad, but nothing good. The food was pretty bland. I think you can do better here.
author: Emily K.

description: Great food and service. My ivy beef was tender and not over sauced. Very hot and fresh spring rolls. Will definitely come again.
author: Gordon L.

description: Yum! Friendly, quick service, yummmmmmy food (try the spicy edamame!!), totally reasonable prices.  I'll be back!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: In a town flooded with mediocre Thai, My Ivy has rekindled my interest in the cuisine. Every vegetable dish I've tried so far have been amazing. My wife had a grilled chicken and pronounced it bland, so YMMV. So far this place is the tops.
author: Mark F.

description: So far so good. A thai place that's close to my house and is clean. That's bi-winning! Seriously, the vegetarian spring rolls with peanut sauce are great. The curries are excellent, far better than anything else in the 1 mile radius of my apt. The papaya salad is always fresh and spicy. I'm really impressed with their start, I'll be going back to this place often.
author: Michael S.

description:
tremendous menu, nice variety, great portions, priced right. Delivery service is often lightning fast. lovely servers happy to help and they hustle.

nothing but good things to say about this place.
author: vladimir p.

description:
bomb food, easy location to get to.  i live a couple blocks away yet it took me this long (6 months) to try it out.  

servers are really polite and know how to bring the food out in intervals as you are finishing each dish...unlike Tortilla Heights across the street! 

it can be a bit noisy there so be prepared.  but again, not like TH across the street :)

angel wings, mango salad, and ginger chicken were all sooooo gooooood!

try an Arnold Palmer if you havent, i should have take a picture to post on here of our meal.  

overall: presentable, great service, and not too expensive for lover pacific heights. id good back an recommend to anyone that doesnt want to bring their children...or drunk friend that chats it up.  seriously!  but we did go in there after the fillmore street festival.

open till 10pm and they deliver for free.
author: Zach S.

description: Really good Padh Thai! Best I've so far actually. Love how tall the Thai Iced Teas Are and the cocktails are nice!
author: Deirdre R.

description: Recommend the chicken pad thai. Add some broccoli.
author: Patrick S.

description: A neighborhood gem! Popped in for a casual dinner while in town visiting a friend. Wow, we were blown away. Everything was fresh, delicious and wonderful. We picked the Pumpkin Curry to share as an entree and immediately regretted not ordering two!
author: Lindsey K.

description: Ordered delivery - Drunken rice with tofu but tofu was missing and the vegetables didn't taste fresh. Portion is on the small side. Very disappointed!
author: Lavinia W.

description: Very good food!! I love coming to My Ivy on my lunch since the service is fast and food is very tasty! The yellow curry is my favorite, I usually get the chicken or pork, both are tasty!
author: Natasha I.

description: Yummy lunch specials. Yellow chicken curry was delicious! Quick and kind service.
author: Katherine C.

description: Live in Lower Pac heights and found this place at the corner of Divisadero and Pine. INCREDIBLE food!! Great service. Cute atmosphere. My new favorite Thai place in the city. Have been here several times with friends and always share everything, so i have tried a lot on the menu. The drunken fried rice is the best I've ever had. The almond prawn appetizer is to die for. Pumpkin curry, lychee prawn curry, fried tofu...all awesome!! Give this place a try!!
author: Terry G.

description: I really enjoyed the veggie yellow curry..broccoli, potatos,carrots, cabbage..delicious dish! I ordered delivery and it was fast and friendly. Pretty cheap,as well! Great neighborhood Thai!
author: Shelley M.

description: My Ivy is the perfect blend of your typical Thai 'cafe' type restaurant with the more upscale restaurants with great decor (Osha, Ozone).  The food here is just as good, I particularly enjoyed the coconut soup, and it also doesn't cost as much.  The reason I give it 4 and not 5 stars, is because it doesn't stand out much when compared to other Thai joints in the area.  I would like to see this place be a little more creative with their menu and add some 'fusion'. Great place nevertheless, you won't be disappointed.
author: Prakhar S.

description: This is my go-to Thai take out spot! I frequent My Ivy probably 2x per week. The wait staff is super friendly and even over the phone, always get your order right. I love their Tom Kha Noodle Soup... If you chose to dine in, their cocktail menu is very fun and different. Its a great little date spot for those in the neighborhood.
author: Marisa C.

description:
Really good food, price is decent, portions are right. 
Love the deep fried salmon rolls served with spicy creamy dipping sauce.
Angle wings were deep fried just right.
Will be back to try other items on the menu.
author: Ol' L.

description: Great Thai food!  Great service, they are all so nice.  Prices are where they should be.  We had chicken satay, spring rolls, pad kee mao, and brown rice, and it was all great.  Cool little cocktail menu too!
author: Ryan H.

description:
My first (and probably last experience) at My Ivy:

Ordered the fresh spring rolls (excellent) and red curry chicken.  

Chicken was raw in many spots, sent it back, they remade, but seemed uncoordinated and awkward.  No return utensils, took app plates without asking, struggled with a wobbly table.  When the curry came back, it was delicious and cooked.  

I'd give it another chance if it wasn't for the inattentive staff (one person just behind the counter texting, no one was available to make eye contact with to get a new fork; had to use the fork of the person I was eating with).

I tried, I really did!  :(
author: Jenny M.

description:
I decided to try My Ivy for lunch on a whim and was so pleasantly surprised!  They have delicious food at affordable prices and they give generous portions.  The service was friendly and timely and the interior is quite clean and minimalist.

For lunch we tried the Papaya Salad with BBQ chicken and the Pad See Ew with beef.  They gave us a complimentary soup to start, which was a nice addition -- nothing groundbreaking but a nice touch.  The Papaya Salad was really tasty and refreshing.  And the BBQ chicken had great flavor -- it had a bit of curry flavor which was nice.  And they also served it with a bowl of rice (I hate it when you have to pay extra for rice).  They grill it with the skin on in case you don't like that but I didn't mind and it added to the flavor.  My husband's beef Pad See Ew was also fantastic -- very generous portion with lots of tasty noodles, broccoli and beef.  A nice balance of salty with a touch of sweet.  

I was so excited to see that they also deliver for dinner service!  Overall, a great experience...I am so glad a good Thai restaurant has come to Divis...and I can't wait to go back to try more!
author: J O.

description: This place is predictably delicious. I recommend the Drunken Noodle or Ginger & Mushroom entrees. The staff are sweet and I have always had fast service.
author: Katy B.

description: Went in a grabbed take out on the way home from Chrissy field last week. T'was their second night open. Food was good and prepared quickly. The people were friendly. The bathroom was clean. An overall solid Thai experience.
author: Brian P.

description: Great place for a quick lunch!  The food was fantastic and reasonably priced.  I had the BBQ chicken and papaya salad.  I am normally not a huge fan of Thai food, but this place has changed my mind!  I can't wait to go back.
author: Emmy G.

description: Fresh, delicious food; warm, inviting atmosphere; friendly, engaged service; great value.  Menu allows you to combine different proteins with different dishes, i.e. chicken or beef yellow curry, shrimp or tofu pad thai, etc.  No problem finding street parking nearby.
author: Adam M.

description: I just ordered takeout.  The vegetarian selection is vast and super tasty.  Their favors are defined and well-balanced.  Delivery took 15 minutes!  This is a gem of lower pacific heights!
author: Lara Z.

description:
Good service, good food.

My Ivy doesn't go above and beyond any other Thai restaurant I've been to, but if you're craving Thai and are in the area I'd definitely recommend it.
author: Pete S.

description: Favorite Thai restaurant in SF. Especially recommend the Salmon Basil and any of the salads.
author: Will H.

description: Best Thai in SF by far! The Tom Kha soup is the best I've had. Must try the spicy edamame and the calamari!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I love this place.  The service is great and quick.  The drinks and food are delicious and very affordable.  The brown rice is great!

Tons of veggie options for vegetarians.  Never had something I didn't like there!
author: Anna O.

description:
Ordered Ivy Beef, Papaya salad & Shrimp Green Curry. Ivy Beef is a must have. Beef is tender and potato that come with it is perfectly cooked ( not overly and mushy) and the seasoning is excellent.

The Papaya salad presentation is really good and it taste equally good with the right amount of fish sauce, lime, chilli, maybe some basil & shrimp sauce I think.

Green Curry is typical just like any other Thai restaurant I have been.
author: andre l.

description: I am a huge fan of Thai food!  The food at My Ivy Thai was good, not great! The chicken lettuce wraps were too "ginger-y" for my tastes! The vegetable and tofu cashew dish was good, but nothing spectacular! I will most likely use this as a go to take out place but doubt I will dine in again.
author: Vanessa L.

description: We have eaten a dozen or more items on the menu both in the restaurant and for take out...everything is excellent!  The ingredients are fresh and the service superb.  A must for the Divis-foodies!!
author: chris r.

description:
Friendly staff, laid back atmosphere, and awesome food at a good price. 

We went there with a group of six, shared a few entrees and a couple appetizers family style, ordered two bottles of sake, and each got our own drink, and it was $20 even per person, tip included.

Go there.
author: Nic H.

description: So, regarding My Ivy--- I LOVE the food, but would rather order-in from this place, than actually go to the restaurant.  Each time I've been there, the wait staff have needed some serious attitude adjustments-- not friendly, helpful, or cooperative in the slightest.   That said, the food, I'm fairly certain, is probably some of my favorite Thai food in the city. I tend to get the pumpkin curry, but when I have veered away from my staple, or have eaten family style there, I've enjoyed every dish.
author: Ami L.

description: I am an avid Thai food indulger and I must say that My Ivy is one of my most favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  I enjoy it for many reasons, besides the food being so delicious and very tasty and fresh, the location is a prime spot for me.  I live in NOPA and so walking a few blocks or easily taking the 24 to get there is no big deal.  It is small enough to still give it a neighborhood restaurant feel and big enough to take a larger party for a night before or after bars in the area if you're staying local.  The shrimp pad see ew and a mango mojito sound fabulous right now!
author: Alexa V.

description: I adored this place and am still dreaming of the crab fried rice. I live in Boston and on a recent trip into San Fran's lower Pac Heights, My boyfriend and I were jonesing for thai food. I quickly got on my food app on my phone and was directed to this restaurant. We visited at about 2 in the afternoon, the restaurant is small and has a cool modern vibe, the drink menu is small too but creative. You seriously got the cool Pac Heights vibe from this place. The fried rice with crab  was to die for and so was the beef with homemade wine sauce and the angel wings were so sticky and sweet...we were embarrassed at how much we were licking our fingers and in ecstasy all at the same time. My Ivy has a think outside of the box mentality when it comes to Thai cooking. I wish we could take this place and sit it down in the heart of Boston. I will go back to San Francisco just to eat here.
author: Shells C.

description: My first yelp review and I wish it was for a good experience, not a bad one. I ordered through My Ivy Thai online and unfortunately I didn't think the order went through. I never received a confirmation from the order because the web page expired. I decided to call My Ivy and place the order over the phone. About 15 minutes later, the delivery person showed up with two orders. He told me that they had an order online from me, as well as over the telephone. I told him that it couldn't be because I never received an order confirmation online. He called his boss and I spoke to her about how I should be refunded for one of the orders. She refused and was rude and unprofessional. She also said she called me three times, however I never picked up. I can assure you she never called. I told her that I would no longer be a customer, though I have supported the business from their initial opening. She said that was fine and hung up. I decided to call Eat 24 to see if they would reverse the charge. Thankfully, they agreed and were pleasant about reversing the charge. I feel that as a customer, My  Ivy should have made the call to Eat 24, not me. Therefore, I will no longer eat at My Ivy Thai. Honestly, if I was out fifty bucks for both orders, whatever, it's more about the principal and how unrealistic and ridiculous the manager of My Thai Ivy was. I hope this is helpful.
author: Lindsay N.

description: We just had a fantastic meal here. The lettuce wraps are a generous portion and very tasty, the pad thai is supreme. Their service is always friendly and the food overall very very good!
author: Jennifer K.

description: So delicious! I've never had a lychee tini. Sweet with a deep delicious melonish flavor. And not too expensive! Very friendly and wonderful atmosphere.
author: Crystal O.

description: Even the $7 lunch I had could not make me give this place two stars. Service was short at lunch--waiting a while before getting our order taken. As the server delivered the bowls of soup, there was a collision at the table which led to the soup falling to the floor. I guess it was considered my fault--no replacement soup for me as my dining companion ate hers. The noodle dish was soggy.
author: Eric M.

description:
Beautifully presented and tasting dishes!  SO good, we could eat here several times a week, and the Thai teas are awesome, too!  Efficient, helpful staff, could be more personable.  

A little gross going through the kitchen to the bathroom, and demerits for not putting in all my leftovers to take home, guess they just picked one of the dishes, but we will go back for sure!
author: Lara M.

description: Nothing exceptional, bu decent food and good service
author: Marco D.

description: We have now been coming here pretty regularly for the last couple years. The food is tasty and the ingredients are fresh. The wait staff is attentive and friendly. I highly recommend the fresh spring rolls! They are very good. We've done delivery a couple times and it's always been quick. The prices are also very reasonable.
author: Tyler S.

description: Go for lunch - the soup is wonderful, and the food is beautifully presented, and delicious. Remodeled, too.
author: Taylor M.

description: The food here seems to be on the higher quality end of the Thai spectrum while still remaining very affordable. Nothing is ever greasy and the service is always pleasant. Highly recommended!
author: Michael H.

description: Very good food, friendly staff and the food comes out quick/delivery is quick too! The portions are pretty big as well. :)
author: Michelle E.

description: Dropped in on a whim for an early dinner and were pleasantly surprised by the wonderful food. I had Tom kha gai and the crispy tofu salad and loved it. Can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.
author: Theresa C.

description: Before my disastrous delivery order, I would have given this place 5 stars. It still pains me to accept that my roommates and I can't order from them anymore out of principle. We used to order from them about once a week ever since they opened. They recognized our delivery address and thought of us as regulars. A few weeks back though, they mixed up our delivery order and thinking it was no big deal, we called them to correct it. The lady who answered it was probably the rudest person I've ever dealt with at a restaurant. She pointed out that we were regulars and knew us but still didnt believe that the order could have been wrong. she challenged us on the phone and screamed at us! they finally sent someone over with the correct curry and had the audacity to charge us! we refused to pay and let the delivery boy leave...our stomachs have been left sad and hungry for thai food ever since. Goodbye my ivy!
author: Kara L.

description: everything is delicious! My new favorite thai place! nice modern atmosphere and fresh yummy food! The prices are very reasonable which makes it even better because I can go there more often.  The soup is amazine, the pad thai is best ive had, the spciy green beans are extremely flavorful, and I loved the chicken curry.
author: Erin Elizabeth K.

description: Great tasting Thai food from fresh, real ingredients, good price, warm yet professional service, and new contemporary ambiance. I was a regular of the old Koon Chang which always reminds me of my visit to Sukhothai. But the new decor, updated menu with the same, fast and friendly staff...makes lunch here more awesome than before and anywhere else in the neighborhood.  I love their grilled chicken and green curry beef and vegetables for lunch...planning to try the yummy duck dinner dish next week with my Sweetie.
author: rosalyn m.

description: Great neighborhood spot for a rainy night. Limited wine selection, but all wine & cocktails are $5. Food was delicious. Spring rolls were fresh and the peanut sauce was excellent! Definitely going back, love that they take reservations.
author: Jill I.

description:
First visit to a new restaurant, two people.  The food was quite a disappointment.   The menu is very limited (particularly in vegetables), all the dishes are a lot smaller than you would expect for the price, and nothing tastes particularly fresh or good.

We ordered Fresh Spring Rolls (raw vegetables wrapped in rice paper), and asked them to omit tofu; the waitress checked with the kitchen, and reported that they could NOT omit tofu because the rolls were all made in advance, and they specifically refused to make one to order.  (The restaurant was empty at the time except for us.)  We ordered it anyway and picked out the tofu, and indeed it tasted tired and pre-made.  Another appetizer was Salmon Rolls, small amounts of mashed salmon rolled up in wonton wrappers and deep-fried; the filling tasted OK, but the wrappers were much too thick and chewy so they dominated the salmon and were hard to eat (four small rolls).

For entrees, we had Pumpkin (Kabocha) Curry with chicken; the red curry sauce was OK, with nice coconut milk flavor, but the dish was small with very little chicken and even less pumpkin (five small cubes).  Another dish was Spicy Eggplant with Pork; this lacked flavor (it was certainly not spicy, at all), had pork cut too thick, and was again short on eggplant (half a dozen pieces).  Carmelized lychee duck featured good roasted duck, but the raw spinach salad served under it had a distasteful sweet dressing, completely inedible.  Trying to get more green vegetables, we had asked for anything made with asparagus, gai lan, snow peas, dao miu, bok choy, sugar snap peas--anything, but nothing was available.  The only green vegetables in the kitchen (we were told) were broccoli, green beans, cabbage, and spinach.  We ordered a side dish of Steamed Mixed Vegetables with Garlic Sauce; it included carrots, mushrooms, broccoli, and a little cabbage,but didn't have much flavor (and in particular we couldn't taste any garlic to speak of).  

Two appetizers and four entrees made a scant dinner for two, because the portions were so small.

The wine list is extremely limited, and restricted to only a few very modest choices.  But corkage is offered at $10, so you should take your own wine.  (We did, and the wine service was fine.)

The restaurant space is clean and new, but minimal.  Very few people came in to sit down while we were there, but there was a trickle of take-away customers.  Service was competent, but not particularly attentive.

Comparing My Ivy to its neighborhood competition, a much better choice would be the nearby Sweet Lime thai restaurant.  Sweet Lime has a wider menu, more vegetables, larger portions, and all the food there tastes much fresher.  It also has a nicer environment, full of fresh flowers, very gracious and welcoming service, and a more-extensive wine list.

I cannot recommend My Ivy based on this visit.  Based on the flood of early reviews here at Yelp, we had expected much better.
author: Robert G.

description: This is a very good Thai restaurant and the price is very reasonable!  I would give them 5 stars if it wasn't for the really awful Boys-2-Men, Spice Girls and Backstreet Boys mix CD on repeat!
author: Jessica K.

description: First time- it was great Thai food and cheaper than I usually find in the city. Friendly staff and the food was fresh, hot and delicious. I recommend the fresh spring rolls (best spicy peanut sauce) and the mango salad for light dinner fare. Of course if you are looking for something a little more hearty you can't go wrong with their curry! Enjoy
author: L W.

description: zero stars!!  i found a cricket in my red curry.  literally.  a big cricket.
author: Ashley B.

description: there were 4 of us and we ordered 3 apps and 4 main dishes. the edamame was spicy and tasty, coconut shrimp was to die for and the chicken stays came with a delish doping sauce!  our main dishes were big! the brown sticky rice is killer. we all really enjoyed the food. cheep beers and friendly waitresses, even tho we came in 20 min to close they still were very friendly to us.  everything we had was delish! I very much so recommend this thai place :)
author: Elise B.

description: What happened! i'm so sad because I love this place but seriously either they got a new chef or just  a bad day. Came here a few nights back and ordered the usual dishes, pad kee mow (vegetarian) and man it was awful. I had not requested for extra spicy and it came out burning my tongue. The noodles were not the right ones that are used , the broccoli was a bit yellow, the carrots had a frozen taste and it's so sad because the staff was super nice. But they really messed up that night. We also got some of the papaya salad that came with the sticky rice, sticky and glue was an understatement, we could grab the entire ball with our fork! i hope it was just an off night, i was super disappointed with the food.
author: sue c.

description: Went here two times for lunch. Had the chicken and pork first time and just pork second time with rice. Both times were very good. Service was good and food came out quick. Also they have an excellent thai iced coffee. Will definitely be back.
author: T L.

description: What a great find! Excellent food, excellent prices. Not in the mood to cook on a Wednesday? - no problem! - with $3.50 beers and $6 appetizers, and most entrees about $10, it's a great excuse to eat out. Plus you can take the leftovers to work the next day for lunch. My husband and I are thrilled we found this place. The only thing that would make this place better is some pillows or padding on the seats. I like a cushy seat when I'm enjoying great Thai food.
author: Gina M.

description: Haven't been here for a month or so, but this place is very yummy. The soup is usually decent for a free soup, the fresh spring rolls are very tasty and quite unique, and the pumpkin curry is very good, as is the lychee duck and the other lunch combo duck dish. Pretty affordable, quick service, good food. Very good lunch spot!
author: Igor B.

description: Great food, friendly service, and they deliver!!  A welcome addition to the neighborhood.  Must tries include the spicy catfish, drunken fried rice, and larb chicken salad.
author: Erick M.

description: Great, fresh, good quality, flavorful, food!  Hightly recommend
author: Nat S.

description: I'm sure the food is good, but the person who answers the phone for takeout/delivery is quite incompetent and doesn't seem to speak very good english.  By far the worst order experience I've ever had.  Their phone service is very static-y, which only makes the experience worse.  I had to repeat my information 4-5 times until she got it right.  Didn't even end up ordering anything because she told me to call back later since their phone service was so bad.
author: Kevin C.

description: I wasn't sure what to expect when we walked in but with my first glance at the menu I was sold. My friend and I were both super hungry after spending the day moving and the food did not disappoint. We shared the fresh spring rolls and the crispy tofu to start. Both of the portions were huge and I really liked both dishes. The spring roll was served in a peanut sauce that I thought was absolutely fab and I liked that unlike most crispy tofu, this version was crispy on the outside while being the right consistency on the inside. The Tom Yom Soup was also really good with a nice balance of meat and veggies plus the right amount of spice. I was not a huge fan of the Pad Ki Mao (drunken noodle) but it was only because of the consistency of the noodles (slightly gummy) and how undercooked the veggies were. That being said everything else was fantastic including my friend's curry, soup and 5 dollar cocktail so I'd definitely go back!
author: Maya H.

description: As a resident of San Francisco, I've been to a good number of restaurants in the city. Tonight, after going to the Opera Plaza for a movie, I happen to go to My Ivy because La Tratoria Food Inc, one of my favorites, was closed. I have to say that I was incredibly disappointed.  The moment I walked in (and maybe it's because of I'm a woman of color: who knows), I was treated like an intruder. The two women who approached me were rude, and continued to be so throughout my dinner experience. I could not help but to notice that while they went to other patrons to ask how their food was, I was never approached, only to sit me and give me the check. The caramelized duck was nothing other than 5 pieces of greasy duck over spinach. I barely finished it. And the wine glass was pretty dirty. I asked the waitress and she said it was on the outside of the glass. Is that any consolation? I love Thai food, but will definitely never go back to My Ivy at all!
author: Migdalia R.
